PC Japanese (JP): ……右代宮家の暴君、金蔵が、ベアトリーチェは蘇る、存在する復活するとのたまわったら、一族の人間は“目下として”肯定的に話を合わせるのではないだろうか。

Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……既然右代宮家的暴君，金藏，在大喊大叫“貝阿朵莉切將會復甦，她是存在的，她將會復活”，那麼這一家子的人，是不是就會“作為晚輩”地，以肯定的態度予以配合呢？

Umineko Project (UP): Though {f:5:Beatrice} only appeared directly in front of a limited number of people,......it's probably safe to say that the concept of her existence penetrated deeply within the Ushiromiya family, even among those who had never seen her.

Umineko Project (UP): However, no matter how deeply that concept penetrated, she was only viewed as a sort of fairy tale character.
Steam (ST): However, no matter how deeply that concept penetrated, she was only viewed as a sort of fairy tale character.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): However, no matter how deeply that concept penetrated, she was only viewed as a sort of fairy tale character.

Steam (ST): It would be necessary to transform the concept of that character from an imaginary fairy tale into reality.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It would be necessary to transform the concept of that character from an imaginary fairy tale into reality.

Russian (RU): И этим чем‐то... была серия ведьминых инцидентов, начиная с шуток старшей {f:5:Беатриче}, когда она раскрывала окна...... и заканчивая конечным убийством в закрытой комнате.

Russian (RU): Очередная странная история о нашем слишком большом особняке.

Chinese Traditional (CHT): 只是右代宮家，那大得毫無意義的大宅裡的，稍微有點那個的怪談之一。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 只是右代宫家，那大得毫无意义的大宅里的，稍微有点那个的怪谈之一。

Umineko Project (UP): The servants would sometimes talk about seeing things or whatever during their night patrols.
Steam (ST): The servants would sometimes talk about seeing things during their night patrols.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The servants would sometimes talk about seeing things during their night patrols.
PC Japanese (JP): 使用人たちが、夜の見回りの時に見たとか見ないとか、たまに喋ってる。
Russian (RU): Слуги время от времени говорили, что во время ночного обхода увидели нечто.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): De vez em quando, os serviçais falam sobre terem vistos coisas durante suas rondas noturnas.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 傭人們偶爾會聊聊，在巡夜時有沒有看到什麼。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 佣人们偶尔会聊聊，在巡夜时有没有看到什么。

Umineko Project (UP): Sometimes, I felt a bit annoyed about them turning my home into a place for ghost stories, but I didn't pay it any more attention than that. That's how little it mattered to me.
Steam (ST): Sometimes, I felt a bit annoyed about them turning my home into a place for ghost stories, but I didn't pay it any more attention than that. That's how little it mattered to me.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Sometimes, I felt a bit annoyed about them turning my home into a place for ghost stories, but I didn't pay it any more attention than that. That's how little it mattered to me.
PC Japanese (JP): 私的には、人の家に勝手に怪談作るなよって思うけど、まぁ、それ以上の話でもない。その程度の話。
Russian (RU): Иногда меня слегка раздражало то, что они превращают мой дом в логово призрачных историй, но не более того. Вот как мало это для меня значило.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Na maioria dos casos, eu fico um pouco incomodada por eles estarem transformando a minha casa em um lugar para histórias de fantasmas, mas ultimamente nem tenho mais prestado atenção nisso. O que mostra o como eu pouco me importo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 雖然我個人覺得“少給別人家亂編怪談”，但對那個也並沒有更多的想法。也就僅此而已。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 虽然我个人觉得“少给别人家乱编怪谈”，但对那个也并没有更多的想法。也就仅此而已。

Umineko Project (UP): So, during my normal, everyday life, I would completely forget about the name "{f:5:Beatrice}".
Steam (ST): So, during my normal, everyday life, I would completely forget about the name "{f:5:Beatrice}".
Original Witch Hunt (OG): So, during my normal, everyday life, I would completely forget about the name 'Beatrice'.
PC Japanese (JP): だから、日常の生活の中では、ベアトリーチェなんて名前は完全に忘れてる。
Russian (RU): Поэтому во время обычной повседневной жизни я совершенно забывала об имени 'Беатриче'.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Por isso, durante a minha vida cotidiana normal, eu esqueço totalmente sobre o nome "{f:5:Beatrice}".
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 所以，在日常生活中，貝阿朵莉切什麼的名字被我完全遺忘了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 所以，在日常生活中，贝阿朵莉切什么的名字被我完全遗忘了。

Umineko Project (UP): Of course, when that huge portrait was first hung, I was definitely creeped out.
Steam (ST): Of course, when that huge portrait was first hung, it definitely felt creepy.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Of course, when that huge portrait was first hung, it definitely felt creepy.
PC Japanese (JP): そりゃ確かに、肖像画が掛けられたばかりの頃は、インパクト絶大で確かに不気味だった。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): そりゃ確かに、肖像画が掛けられたばかりの頃は、インパクト絶大で不気味だった。
Russian (RU): Разумеется, когда этот огромный портрет только повесили, он и впрямь выглядел жутковатым.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): É claro, quando aquele retrato imenso foi pendurado, aquilo definitivamente me assustou.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 的確，在剛掛上肖像畫時，那場面極具衝擊力，的確很陰森。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 的确，在刚挂上肖像画时，那场面极具冲击力，的确很阴森。

Umineko Project (UP): Even I tried not to meet her eyes after dark, so yeah, I don't blame the servants for finding it eerie.
Steam (ST): Even I tried not to meet her eyes after dark, so it's no surprise that the servants found it eerie.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Even I'd try not to meet her eyes after dark, so it's no surprise that the servants found it eerie.
PC Japanese (JP): 暗くなってからは、肖像画に目を合わせないようにしてたし、使用人たちが不気味がるのも無理ない話さ。
Russian (RU): Даже я с наступлением темноты старалась не встречаться с ней взглядом, поэтому неудивительно, что слуги считали его жутким.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu até tentava evitar olhar durante a noite, por isso, bem, eu não culpo os serviçais por acharem sinistro.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 天一黑，我就會刻意避而不看肖像畫中之人的眼睛，傭人們會感到毛骨悚然，也是沒辦法的事。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 天一黑，我就会刻意避而不看肖像画中之人的眼睛，佣人们会感到毛骨悚然，也是没办法的事。

Umineko Project (UP): But that only lasted for a short while.{n}I mean, I walked by that portrait every day.
Steam (ST): But that only lasted for a short while. We all walked by the portrait every day.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): But that only lasted for a short while. We all walked by the portrait every day.
PC Japanese (JP): しかし、それは最初の頃の話。こちとら、毎日、肖像画の前を横断してる。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): しかし、それは最初の頃の話。{n}こちとら、毎日、肖像画の前を横断してる。
Russian (RU): Но так было только поначалу.{n}Все мы проходили мимо портрета каждый день.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mas isso só durou um certo tempo.{n}Quero dizer, eu passo pelo retrato todo santo dia.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 但是，這是最開始時的事。{n}咱們可是每天都在肖像畫前橫穿而過。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 但是，这是最开始时的事。{n}咱们可是每天都在肖像画前横穿而过。

Umineko Project (UP): I gradually got used to it, and eventually bored of it.
Steam (ST): We gradually got used to it, and eventually bored of it.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): We gradually got used to it, and eventually bored of it.
PC Japanese (JP): 次第に慣れて、飽きてきて。
Russian (RU): Постепенно мы привыкли к нему и потеряли интерес.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Então fui me acostumando com ele e logo me cansei.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 漸漸地就習慣了，膩了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 渐渐地就习惯了，腻了。

Umineko Project (UP): It was just a portrait that Grandfather blew a bunch of money on, showing the mistress from his delusions... I was past caring.
Steam (ST): I didn't really care anymore about the portrait of the mistress from Grandfather's delusions.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I didn't really care anymore about the portrait of the mistress from Grandfather's delusions.
PC Japanese (JP): 祖父さまがカネに飽かせて描かせた、妄想愛人の肖像画なんて、どうでもよくなっちまった。
Russian (RU): Меня больше нисколько не волновал портрет любовницы из заблуждений деда.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Era só um retrato que o vovô investiu muita grana só para exibir a amante de suas fantasias... Eu acabei me acostumando.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 爺爺揮金如土地叫人畫的妄想情婦的肖像畫，關我們鳥事。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 爷爷挥金如土地叫人画的妄想情妇的肖像画，关我们鸟事。

Speaker: Willard H. Wright
Umineko Project (UP): "I get that. I'll bet it was different for the other relatives, who only came a few times a year."
Steam (ST): "I get that. I'll bet it was different for the other relatives, who only came a few times a year."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「だろうな。年に何度も来ない親戚連中ならともかく。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「だろうな。年に何度も来ない親戚連中ならともかく」
Russian (RU): "Понимаю. Наверняка для других родственников, приезжающих всего несколько раз в год, всё было иначе."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Entendi. Aposto que para os outros parentes é diferente, afinal só vêm aqui algumas vezes ao ano."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「也是。若是換成一年來不了幾次的那幫親戚，那還好說。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「也是。若是换成一年来不了几次的那帮亲戚，那还好说。」

Speaker: Ushiromiya Jessica
Umineko Project (UP): "Exactly. That's why every time the family came for a family conference, they'd always stand in front of that portrait and talk about {f:5:Beatrice}. So, I was reminded of it every year."
Steam (ST): "Exactly. That's why every time the family came for a family conference, they'd always stand in front of that portrait and talk about {f:5:Beatrice}. So, I was reminded of it every now and then."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Exactly. That's why every time the family came for a family conference, they'd always stand in front of that portrait and talk about Beatrice. So, I was reminded of it every year."
PC Japanese (JP): 「そういうこと。だから、親族会議になると親戚たちが必ず肖像画の前で、決まってベアトリーチェの話をする。だから定期的に思い出させられるのさ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「そういうこと。だから、親族会議になると親戚たちが必ず肖像画の前で、決まってベアトリーチェの話をする。だから定期的に思い出させられるのさ」
Russian (RU): "Именно. Приезжая на семейное собрание, семья всегда стоит перед этим портретом и обсуждает {f:5:Беатриче}. Поэтому мне напоминают о нём каждый год."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Sim. É por isso que toda vez que chega a conferência familiar, eles sempre param na frente do quadro e ficam falando sobre a {f:5:Beatrice}. Por isso, todo ano eu acabo sendo lembrada."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「是的。所以，每當親族會議時，親戚們就一定會聚在肖像畫前，談起貝阿朵莉切。所以，這定期地令我把那事回想起來。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「是的。所以，每当亲族会议时，亲戚们就一定会聚在肖像画前，谈起贝阿朵莉切。所以，这定期地令我把那事回想起来。」

Umineko Project (UP): "Uu, {f:5:Beatrice}!! I've come to play again...! I've drawn another new spell. Take a look at it later, okay?! Uu!"
Steam (ST): "Uu-, {f:5:Beatrice}!! I've come to play again...! I've written a new spell. Take a look at it later, okay?! Uu-!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Uu-, Beatrice!! I've come to play again...! I've drawn another new spell. Take a look at it later, okay?! Uu-!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「うー、ベアトリーチェ！！　また遊びに来たよ…！　また新しい魔法を書いたの。後で見てね！　うー！」
Russian (RU): "У‐у, {f:5:Беатриче}! Я снова пришла поиграть!.. Я нарисовала ещё одно новое заклинание. Взгляни попозже, ладно?! У‐у!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Uu, {f:5:Beatrice}!! Vim para brincar de novo...! Já escrevi outro feitiço. Pode olhar ele depois?! Uu!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「嗚——，貝阿朵莉切！！真里亞又來玩了喲…！真里亞又寫了新的魔法。等下給你看！嗚——！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「呜——，贝阿朵莉切！！真里亚又来玩了哟…！真里亚又写了新的魔法。等下给你看！呜——！」

Speaker: Ushiromiya George
Umineko Project (UP): "You really do like {f:5:Beatrice}, don't you? You've been in such high spirits ever since Grandfather had this portrait hung."
Steam (ST): "You really do like {f:5:Beatrice}, don't you? You've been in such high spirits ever since Grandfather had this portrait hung."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "You really do like Beatrice, don't you? You've been in such high spirits ever since Grandfather had this portrait hung."
PC Japanese (JP): 「真里亞ちゃんは本当にベアトリーチェが好きだなぁ。お祖父さまが肖像画を掲げて以来、大喜びみたいだ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「真里亞ちゃんは本当にベアトリーチェが好きだなぁ。お祖父さまが肖像画を掲げて以来、大喜びみたいだ」
Russian (RU): "Тебе так нравится {f:5:Беатриче}, да? Ты в таком хорошем настроении с тех пор, как дедушка повесил этот портрет."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Você gosta mesmo da {f:5:Beatrice}, não gosta? Você tem andado bem animada desde que o vovô dependurou esse quadro imenso."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「小真里亞真是好喜歡貝阿朵莉切呢。好像自從爺爺掛出了那副肖像畫，她就一直很高興呢。」

Umineko Project (UP): "Huh? Where's Ange?"
Steam (ST): "Huh? Where's Ange?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]

Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「啊咧？緣壽呢？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「啊咧？缘寿呢？」

Speaker: Ushiromiya George
Umineko Project (UP): "She went back with Aunt Kyrie to take some medicine."
Steam (ST): "She went back with Aunt Kyrie to take some medicine."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "She went back with Kyrie oba-san to take some medicine."

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「霧江叔母さんと薬を飲みに戻ったよ」
Russian (RU): "Вернулась вместе с тётей Кирие принять лекарство."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Ela voltou com a tia Kyrie para tomar um remédio."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Jessica
Umineko Project (UP): "Ange gets sick so easy. ......Totally the opposite of Battler."
Steam (ST): "Her body really is frail. ...Totally the opposite of Battler."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Her body really is frail. ......Totally the opposite of Battler."
PC Japanese (JP): 「縁寿は本当に体が弱ぇなぁ。……戦人とは大違いだぜ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「縁寿は本当に体が弱ぇなぁ。……戦人とは大違いだぜ」

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「缘寿真的，身体好弱啊。……和战人大不相同。」

Speaker: Ushiromiya George
Umineko Project (UP): "She's the sort that gets sick whenever she's stressed. I also used to get sick on big holidays or days when we were going to the movies."
Steam (ST): "She's the sort that gets sick whenever she's stressed. I also used to get sick on big holidays or trips."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "She's the sort that gets sick whenever she's stressed. I also used to get sick on big holidays or trips."
PC Japanese (JP): 「緊張すると体調を崩すタイプなんだよ。僕も昔は、遠足の日や映画の日なんかに限って、体調を崩したりしたもんさ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「緊張すると体調を崩すタイプなんだよ。僕も昔は、遠足の日や映画の日なんかに限って、体調を崩したりしたもんさ」
Russian (RU): "Она из тех, кто всегда заболевает, когда сильно нервничает. Я тоже постоянно заболевал по большим праздникам и в поездках."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Ela é do tipo que adoece sempre que fica estressada. Eu já me acostumei a ficar doente em grandes feriados ou em dias que vou ao cinema."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「她是屬於，一緊張就體況欠佳的那種類型喲。我以前也是，每逢郊游或看電影的日子，就體況欠佳。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「她是属于，一紧张就体况欠佳的那种类型哟。我以前也是，每逢郊游或看电影的日子，就体况欠佳。」

Speaker: Ushiromiya Jessica
Umineko Project (UP): "Maria's really tough by comparison. ......She's been talking about {f:5:Beatrice} non‐stop since we left Niijima. ......Don't you think she's taking this a bit too far?"
Steam (ST): "Maria's really tough by comparison. ...She's been talking about {f:5:Beatrice} non-stop since we left Niijima. ...Don't you think she's taking this a bit too far?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Maria's really tough by comparison. ......She's been talking about Beatrice non-stop since we left Niijima. ......Don't you think she's taking this a bit too far?"
PC Japanese (JP): 「それに比べたら真里亞はタフだぜ。……新島からこっちに来るまでの間、ずっとベアトリーチェの話三昧さ。……ここしばらくずっとだけど、ちょっと行きすぎだよなぁ？」
Russian (RU): "Мария не идёт ни в какое сравнение. ......Она не переставала говорить о {f:5:Беатриче} всю дорогу от Нииджимы. ......Тебе не кажется, что она воспринимает это чересчур серьёзно?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Em comparação, a Maria é bem durona. ......Ela está falando sem parar sobre a {f:5:Beatrice} desde que saímos de Niijima. ......Não acha que ela está levando isso longe demais?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「與她一比，真里亞可真結實嘞。……從新島到這的路上，就一直在專心致志地講貝阿朵莉切的事。……雖然最近一直都這樣，但她是不是稍微有點過頭了？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「与她一比，真里亚可真结实嘞。……从新岛到这的路上，就一直在专心致志地讲贝阿朵莉切的事。……虽然最近一直都这样，但她是不是稍微有点过头了？」

Speaker: Ushiromiya George
Umineko Project (UP): "It's not so bad, right? It's normal for kids to have an active imagination. If a kid told you that she'd met Santa Claus, would you tell her she's a liar?"
Steam (ST): "It's not so bad, right? It's normal for kids to have an active imagination. If a kid told you that she'd met Santa Claus, would you tell her she's a liar?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「いいんじゃないかな。子供の想像遊びだよ。朱志香ちゃんは子供が、サンタクロースに会ったことがあるって言い出したら、嘘だって言っちゃうのかい？」
Russian (RU): "Почему бы и нет. Для детей нормально иметь активное воображение. Если бы ребёнок сказал тебе, что встретил Санта Клауса, ты бы сказала, что он лжёт?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Não é ruim, é? É normal que crianças tenham uma imaginação ativa. Se uma criança disser que encontrou o Papai Noel, você vai dizer que ela é uma mentirosa?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「有什麼不好呢？這是小孩子的想像遊戲喲。朱志香，若是有小孩說，自己見過聖誕老人，你會去跟他說，那是騙人的麼？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「有什么不好呢？这是小孩子的想象游戏哟。朱志香，若是有小孩说，自己见过圣诞老人，你会去跟他说，那是骗人的么？」

Speaker: Ushiromiya Jessica
Umineko Project (UP): "......Well, of course I wouldn't go that far."
Steam (ST): "...Well, of course I wouldn't go that far."

Umineko Project (UP): George, a man, seemed to think that this behavior from a younger member of the opposite sex was cute.
Steam (ST): George, a man, seemed to think that this behavior from a younger member of the opposite sex was cute.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): George, a man, seemed to think that this behavior from a younger member of the opposite sex was cute.
PC Japanese (JP): 男である譲治は、異性で年下の真里亞のそういう行為を、微笑ましく思っているようだ。
Russian (RU): Джордж считал такое поведение младшего члена противоположного пола милым.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): George, um homem, parecia pensar que esse tipo de comportamento, vindo de uma jovem do sexo oposto, era adorável.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 身為男性的讓治好像認為，身為異性且年紀比自己小的真里亞的這種行為引人微笑。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 身为男性的让治好像认为，身为异性且年纪比自己小的真里亚的这种行为引人微笑。

Umineko Project (UP): ......But, to be perfectly frank...
Steam (ST): ...But, to be perfectly frank...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ……しかし、正直に白状すると。
Russian (RU): ......Но если говорить совершенно откровенно...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Mas, sendo bem honesta...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……不過，老實坦白說。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……不过，老实坦白说。

Umineko Project (UP): ...Jessica, who was the same sex as Maria, found this behavior a bit unpleasant regardless of Maria's age.
Steam (ST): Jessica, who was the same sex as Maria, found this behavior a bit unpleasant, even though she realized that she was dealing with a younger girl.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Jessica, who was the same sex as Maria, found this behavior a bit unpleasant, even though she realized that the other girl was younger.
PC Japanese (JP): 同性である朱志香は、いくら年下とはいえ、真里亞のそういう行為を、少しだけ気持ち悪くも思っていた。
Russian (RU): Джессика, которая была того же пола, что и Мария, считала подобное поведение несколько неприятным, хоть и понимала, что другая девочка младше.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Jessica, que era uma garota, assim como Maria, achava aquele comportamento meio desagradável, independente da idade de Maria.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 在身為同性的朱志香看來，再怎麼說年紀比自己小，她還是稍微有點對真里亞的這種行為感到噁心。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 在身为同性的朱志香看来，再怎么说年纪比自己小，她还是稍微有点对真里亚的这种行为感到恶心。

Umineko Project (UP): At one time, even I was fascinated by anime heroines and other fictional characters.
Steam (ST): At one time, even I was fascinated by anime heroines and other fictional characters.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): At one time, even I was fascinated by anime heroines and other fictional characters.
PC Japanese (JP): アニメのヒロインなどの、架空の存在に憧れる年頃は、自分にもあった。
Russian (RU): Когда‐то даже я была очарована аниме‐героинями и другими вымышленными персонажами.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Teve um tempo que eu também era obcecada por heroínas de animes e personagens fictícios.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 她自己也經歷過，憧憬動畫片女主角等虛構人物的年齡。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 她自己也经历过，憧憬动画片女主角等虚构人物的年龄。

Umineko Project (UP): However, ......Maria's behavior seems to signify something more direct than mere fascination. ......It's something much more definite, ......more vivid.
Steam (ST): However, ...Maria's behavior seems to signify something more direct than mere fascination. ...It's something more definite, ...more vivid.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): However, ......Maria's behavior seems to signify something more direct than mere fascination. ......It's something more definite......more vivid.
PC Japanese (JP): でも、……真里亞のそれは、憧れるとかそういう間接的なものじゃない。……もっともっと具体的な、……何というか、生々しいのだ。
Russian (RU): Но...... поведение Марии словно означает нечто большее, чем просто очарование. ......Нечто более определённое...... более яркое.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mas ......o comportamento da Maria parecia significativamente mais direto que um mero fascínio. ......É algo muito mais definido, ......mais vívido.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 不過，……真里亞的那個，根本就不是憧憬之類的間接行為。……而是更加更加具體的，……該怎麼說好呢，赤裸裸的那個。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 不过，……真里亚的那个，根本就不是憧憬之类的间接行为。……而是更加更加具体的，……该怎么说好呢，赤裸裸的那个。

Umineko Project (UP): Am I the only one who notices something odd about her?
Steam (ST): Am I the only one who notices something odd about her?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Am I the only one who notices something odd about her?
PC Japanese (JP): 私だけが、その違和感に気付いていたのだろうか。
Russian (RU): Я одна заметила в ней странность?
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu sou a única que percebe algo estranho nela?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 是只有我一人，感受到了這份異樣的感覺嗎？
Chinese Simplified (CN): 是只有我一人，感受到了这份异样的感觉吗？

Umineko Project (UP): ......I'll bet the others all notice too, but try to ignore it because of that adult dignity George nii‐san is always talking about.
Steam (ST): ...I'll bet the others all notice too, but try to ignore it because of that adult dignity George nii-san is always talking about.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......I'll bet the others all notice too, but try to ignore it because of that adult dignity George nii-san is always talking about.
PC Japanese (JP): ……きっとみんなも気付いていて、だけれども譲治兄さんの言うように、大人の貫禄で無視しているだけなのだろうか。
Russian (RU): .....Наверняка все остальные тоже заметили, но игнорируют из‐за достоинства взрослого, о котором всегда говорит Джордж.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Eu aposto que os outros também percebem, mas tentam ignorar isso por causa da dignidade adulta que o George nii‐san tá sempre comentando.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……還是，大家也一定都意識到了，只是在如讓治大哥說的那樣，以大人的態度故意無視呢？
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……还是，大家也一定都意识到了，只是在如让治大哥说的那样，以大人的态度故意无视呢？

Speaker: Ushiromiya Krauss
Umineko Project (UP): "......My apologies, everyone. The head is quite busy with his noble research. He wishes to eat lunch in his study today."
Steam (ST): "...My apologies, everyone. The Head is quite busy with his noble research. He wishes to eat lunch in his study today."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......My apologies, everyone. The Head is quite busy with his noble research. He wishes to eat lunch in his study today."
PC Japanese (JP): 「……申し訳ないね、諸君。当主様は高尚な研究で大変お忙しい。昼は書斎で取られると仰せだ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……申し訳ないね、諸君。当主様は高尚な研究で大変お忙しい。昼は書斎で取られると仰せだ」
Russian (RU): "......Прошу прощения, дамы и господа. Глава очень занят своими благородными исследованиями. Сегодня он пожелал отобедать в своём кабинете."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Eu peço desculpas, pessoal. O chefe está muito ocupado com a sua nobre pesquisa. Ele deseja desfrutar de seu almoço dentro de seu estúdio hoje."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……非常抱歉，諸位。當主大人在進行高尚的研究，非常忙。他老人家說了，在書房用午餐。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……非常抱歉，诸位。当主大人在进行高尚的研究，非常忙。他老人家说了，在书房用午餐。」

Umineko Project (UP): Until a second ago, Kinzo's children were complaining that eating lunch with their father would give them indigestion.
Steam (ST): Until a second ago, Kinzo's children had been complaining that eating lunch with their father would give them indigestion.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 金蔵と一緒のランチなんて、消化不良を起こしそうで嫌だと、さっきまでさんざん愚痴っていた親族兄弟たち。
Russian (RU): Ещё секунду назад дети Кинзо жаловались, что от обеда с их отцом у них будет расстройство желудка.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Até um segundo atrás, os filhos de Kinzo estavam reclamando que almoçar com seu pai os deixaria com indigestão.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 親族四兄妹直到剛才還在拚命發牢騷，和金藏共進晚餐搞不好會引起消化不良，討厭死了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 亲族四兄妹直到刚才还在拼命发牢骚，和金藏共进晚餐搞不好会引起消化不良，讨厌死了。

Umineko Project (UP): But now that they knew he wasn't coming, they started grumbling about how he should at least spare the time to come down during the annual family conferences.
Steam (ST): But now that they knew he wasn't coming, they started grumbling about how he should at least spare the time to come down during the annual family conferences.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): But now that they knew he wasn't coming, they started grumbling about how he should at least spare the time to come down during the annual family conferences.
PC Japanese (JP): しかし、いざ来ないとわかったら、今度は、たまの親族会議の時くらい、降りてくればいいのにと悪態をつく。
Russian (RU): Но теперь, зная, что он не придёт, они начали ворчать о том, как он должен хотя бы соизволить спуститься во время ежегодного семейного собрания.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mas agora que era certo que ele não apareceria, todos começaram a murmurar sobre como ele deveria ao menos aparecer durante a conferência anual da família.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 然而，一旦知道他不來了，這次他們又開始抱怨起了，在實屬難得的親族會議的日子，下趟樓又有何妨。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 然而，一旦知道他不来了，这次他们又开始抱怨起了，在实属难得的亲族会议的日子，下趟楼又有何妨。

Speaker: Gohda Toshiro
Umineko Project (UP): "Then let us begin lunch, everyone. I, Gohda, have made use of all my talent and experience to make sure that all of you, who have come from so far away, will be entirely satisfied with your meal..."
Steam (ST): "Then let us begin lunch, everyone. I, Gohda, have made use of all my talent and experience to make sure that you guests, who have come from so far away, will be entirely satisfied with your meal..."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Then let us begin lunch, everyone. I, Gohda, have made use of all my talent and experience to make sure that you guests, who have come from so far away, will be entirely satisfied with your meal..."
PC Japanese (JP): 「それでは皆様、ランチを始めさせていただきます。遠方よりお集まりの皆様をお持て成しできるよう、この郷田、腕によりをかけてご用意させていただきました…。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「それでは皆様、ランチを始めさせていただきます。遠方よりお集まりの皆様をお持て成しできるよう、この郷田、腕によりをかけてご用意させていただきました…」
Russian (RU): "Что ж, дамы и господа, начнём обед. Я, Года, использовал весь свой талант и опыт, чтобы гости, которые приехали из такой дали, были всецело довольны трапезой..."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Então vamos dar início, pessoal. Eu, Gohda, fiz uso de todos os meus talentos e experiência para garantir que todos os presentes, que de muito longe vieram até aqui, ficarão completamente satisfeitos com sua refeição..."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「那麼諸位，午餐自此開始。為了能好好款待自遠方而來的諸位，鄙人鄉田，可是傾盡了全部本領地準備了這次午餐…」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「那么诸位，午餐自此开始。为了能好好款待自远方而来的诸位，鄙人乡田，可是倾尽了全部本领地准备了这次午餐…」

Umineko Project (UP): No one's stomach would fail to rumble after hearing that from the great Chef Gohda.
Steam (ST): No one's stomach would fail to rumble after hearing that from the Great Chef Gohda.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): No one's stomach would fail to rumble after hearing that from the Great Chef Gohda.
PC Japanese (JP): 大シェフ郷田にそう言われては、お腹の虫が鳴らない者はいない。
Russian (RU): Ни один желудок не мог устоять, услышав такое от великого шеф‐повара Годы.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Nenhum estômago falharia em roncar após ouvir tais palavras do Grande Chef Gohda.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 聽大廚鄉田這麼一說，沒有人肚子不咕咕叫的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 听大厨乡田这么一说，没有人肚子不咕咕叫的。

Umineko Project (UP): By the time the splendid dishes were laid out, everyone had stopped talking about Kinzo's absence...
Steam (ST): By the time the splendid dishes were laid out, everyone had stopped talking about Kinzo's absence...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): By the time the splendid dishes were laid out, everyone had stopped talking about Kinzo's absence...
PC Japanese (JP): 見事な皿が並ぶ頃には、金蔵の不在を話題にする者はいなくなっていた…。
Russian (RU): К тому времени, как великолепные блюда были расставлены, все перестали говорить об отсутствии Кинзо...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): No momento em que esplêndidos pratos foram servidos, todos pararam de falar sobre a ausência de Kinzo...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 在把一盤盤美味佳餚擺上桌時，已沒人在談金藏缺席的話題了…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 在把一盘盘美味佳肴摆上桌时，已没人在谈金藏缺席的话题了…。

Umineko Project (UP): It was now Ange's absence that was being discussed.
Steam (ST): It was now Ange's absence that was being discussed.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It was now Ange's absence that was being discussed.
PC Japanese (JP): 今、不在で話題になってるのは縁寿だ。
Russian (RU): Сейчас обсуждали отсутствие Энджи.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Agora era a ausência de Ange que estava em discussão.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 此刻，因缺席而成了話題之人的，是緣壽。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 此刻，因缺席而成了话题之人的，是缘寿。

Umineko Project (UP): Apparently, her stomachache had gotten so bad that neither she nor Kyrie could make it to lunch.
Steam (ST): Apparently, her stomachache had gotten so bad that both she and Kyrie couldn't make it to lunch.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Apparently, her stomachache had gotten so bad that both she and Kyrie could not make it to lunch.
PC Japanese (JP): 腹痛が酷くなってしまったらしく、ランチには霧江ともども、現れなかった。
Russian (RU): Похоже, у неё так сильно заболел живот, что они с Кирие не смогли прийти на обед.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Aparentemente, suas dores de barriga ficaram tão ruins que nem Kyrie pôde ficar para o almoço.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 她好像因腹痛變嚴重了，而與霧江一起，沒有在午餐席上現身。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 她好像因腹痛变严重了，而与雾江一起，没有在午餐席上现身。

Speaker: Ushiromiya Natsuhi
Umineko Project (UP): "Poor thing. ......Gohda. Make sure you talk to Kyrie‐san later and have some porridge made."
Steam (ST): "Poor thing. ...Gohda, make sure you talk to Kyrie-san later and have some porridge made."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Poor thing. ......Gohda. Make sure you talk to Kyrie-san later and have some porridge made."
PC Japanese (JP): 「可哀想に。……郷田。後で霧江さんに相談して、おかゆのようなものを用意するように。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「可哀想に。……郷田。後で霧江さんに相談して、おかゆのようなものを用意するように」
Russian (RU): "Бедняжка. ......Года. Обязательно попозже поговори с Кирие и сделай каши."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Coitadinha. ......Gohda. Trate de falar com a Kyrie‐san depois e prepare um pouco de mingau de arroz."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「好可怜。……鄉田。等下和霧江妹妹談談，去準備點粥之類的東西吧。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「好可怜。……乡田。等下和雾江妹妹谈谈，去准备点粥之类的东西吧。」

Speaker: Ushiromiya Rudolf
Umineko Project (UP): "Thanks a bunch for the concern. ......Really sorry about this. Seems she just can't handle much stress."
Steam (ST): "Thanks for the concern. ...Sorry about all this. It seems she just can't handle much stress."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「あぁ、気を利かせてくれてありがとう。……本当にすまねぇなぁ。どうも緊張に弱い子みたいでなぁ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「あぁ、気を利かせてくれてありがとう。……本当にすまねぇなぁ。どうも緊張に弱い子みたいでなぁ」
Russian (RU): "Благодарю за заботу. ......Простите. Просто она не справляется с большим стрессом."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Muito obrigado pela preocupação. ......Eu sinto muito por isso. Ela parece não conseguir lidar com muito estresse."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「啊，嫂子您有心了，謝謝。……真是不好意思啊。那孩子，好像很容易被緊張壓垮。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「啊，嫂子您有心了，谢谢。……真是不好意思啊。那孩子，好像很容易被紧张压垮。」

Speaker: Ushiromiya Hideyoshi
Umineko Project (UP): "That's how it is when they're young. They're cute, at least when they're not regurgitatin'."
Steam (ST): "That's how it is with young'uns. They're cute, at least when they're not regurgitatin'."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「幼いうちはそんなもんや。吐いたりしないだけ可愛いもんやで。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「幼いうちはそんなもんや。吐いたりしないだけ可愛いもんやで」
Russian (RU): "Вот как бывает у молодых. Они милые, по крайней мере, когда не срыгивают."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "É assim que se é quando são jovens. São fofas, ao menos quando não estão regurgitando."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「小時候是這樣的吶。沒吐出來就已經夠惹人疼愛了吶。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「小时候是这样的呐。没吐出来就已经够惹人疼爱了呐。」

Speaker: Ushiromiya Eva
Umineko Project (UP): "George used to do that all the time. He really was frail, way back then. Right?"
Steam (ST): "George used to do that all the time. He really was frail, way back then. Right?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「譲治はよく吐いたわねぇ。昔は本当に病弱だったのよ。ねぇ？」
Russian (RU): "У Джорджа всё время так было. Раньше он был очень хилым. Правда?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "O George fazia isso o tempo todo. Ele era mesmo frágil quando criança. Não era?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「讓治可是老吐出來哦。以前，你可真是個體弱多病的小孩喲。是吧？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「让治可是老吐出来哦。以前，你可真是个体弱多病的小孩哟。是吧？」

Speaker: Ushiromiya George
Umineko Project (UP): "Let's not talk about the past... It's not exactly a mealtime topic."
Steam (ST): "Let's not talk about the past... It's not exactly a mealtime topic."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「昔の話は許してよ…。食事時にする話じゃないよ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「昔の話は許してよ…。食事時にする話じゃないよ」
Russian (RU): "Давай не будем говорить о прошлом... Эта тема не для обсуждения за столом."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Podemos não falar sobre o passado...? Não é um bom tópico para se conversar durante uma refeição."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「以前的事，就別說了…。這不是吃飯時說的事。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「以前的事，就别说了…。这不是吃饭时说的事。」

Speaker: Ushiromiya Maria
Umineko Project (UP): "Uu. Poor Ange. She doesn't get to eat this yummy food?"
Steam (ST): "Uu-. Poor Ange. So she won't get to eat this yummy food?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Uu-. Poor Ange. She doesn't get to eat this yummy food."
PC Japanese (JP): 「うー。縁寿、可哀想。こんなおいしいごはんなのに、食べられない？」
Russian (RU): "У‐у. Бедная Энджи. Она не сможет съесть такую вкусную еду."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Uu. Coitada da Ange. Ela não vai comer essa comida gostosa?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「嗚——。緣壽，好可怜。明明午飯那麼好吃，可她卻吃不到？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「呜——。缘寿，好可怜。明明午饭那么好吃，可她却吃不到？」

Speaker: Ushiromiya Jessica
Umineko Project (UP): "Yeah, poor girl. Let's make sure we play with her a lot when she gets better."
Steam (ST): "Yeah, poor kid. Let's make sure we play with her a lot when she gets better."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「可哀想になぁ。元気になったら、その分、いっぱい遊んであげようぜ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「可哀想になぁ。元気になったら、その分、いっぱい遊んであげようぜ」
Russian (RU): "Да, бедняжка. Давай обязательно поиграем с ней, когда ей станет лучше."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Sim, coitadinha. Vamos brincar muito com a Ange depois que ela melhorar."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「可怜啊。等她變精神了，作為補償，來陪她好好玩個夠吧。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「可怜啊。等她变精神了，作为补偿，来陪她好好玩个够吧。」

Speaker: Ushiromiya Maria
Umineko Project (UP): "Uu, can't. She can't play with me."
Steam (ST): "Uu-, no way. She can't play with me."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Uu-, can't. She can't play with me."
PC Japanese (JP): 「うー、だめー。真里亞とは遊べなーい。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「うー、だめー。真里亞とは遊べなーい」

Speaker: Ushiromiya Jessica
Umineko Project (UP): "Everyone has something they really want to become. But they never do it. ......The restrictions on their everyday life are what made them who they are today, so they have no way of changing themselves."
Steam (ST): "Everyone has a "self" they really want to become. But they can't do it. ...Their current self is always surrounded by their lifestyle and the limits placed on them, so they have no way of changing themselves."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「誰だって、自分が本当になりたい自分があるんだ。でも、なれない。……生活やしがらみの中に今の自分がいるからこそ、今の自分を変えるなんてこと、出来やしないんだ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「誰だって、自分が本当になりたい自分があるんだ。でも、なれない。……生活やしがらみの中に今の自分がいるからこそ、今の自分を変えるなんてこと、出来やしないんだ」

Umineko Project (UP): "You felt suffocated, forced to live the life of a rich family's daughter, and you thought up a "self" that you wanted to be."
Steam (ST): "You felt suffocated, forced to live the life of a rich family's daughter, and you envisioned the "self" that you wanted to be."

Umineko Project (UP): It's not a bad feeling when you learn something new and your parents praise you. ......But when you realize that your parents already knew that thing, it sometimes feels like they're talking down to you.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Jessica
Umineko Project (UP): "So, it's easy to guess why Maria got interested in the occult, something no one else knew about, and started learning more and more about it. ......I think the person Maria wants to be...is an authority on the occult who is respected by everyone."

PC Japanese (JP): 「だから真里亞が、誰も知らないオカルトに関心を持ち、その知識を深めていったのは容易に想像できる。……多分、真里亞にとっての理想の自分というのは、みんなに尊敬されるオカルトの権威の自分なんだ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「だから真里亞が、誰も知らないオカルトに関心を持ち、その知識を深めていったのは容易に想像できる。……多分、真里亞にとっての理想の自分というのは、みんなに尊敬されるオカルトの権威の自分なんだ」
Russian (RU): "Так что легко догадаться, почему Мария заинтересовалась оккультизмом, о котором никто ничего не знал, и начала углубляться в его изучение. ......Думаю, Мария хочет быть уважаемым всеми профессионалом в оккультизме."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Logo, é fácil imaginar o motivo pelo qual a Maria se interessou pelo ocultismo, algo que ninguém mais tinha conhecimento, e começou a aprender cada vez mais sobre isso. ......Eu acho que a pessoa que a Maria quer ser...é uma autoridade no campo do ocultismo, na qual todos respeitem."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「所以真里亞才對沒人知道的神秘學抱有興趣，深入學習了這方面的知識，這點可以輕易想像得到。……多半，對真里亞來說的理想的自己，就是受大家尊敬的，身為神秘學的權威的自己。」

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「普段の生活でオカルトの話ばかりしていたら、楼座にぶたれるからな。……お前がそうであるように、普段はもう一人の自分を隠している、というわけだ」
Russian (RU): "И Роза бьёт её, если она говорит об оккультизме в повседневной жизни. ......Поэтому, как и ты, она большую часть времени скрывает другую себя."
