Umineko Project (UP): It wasn't the witch or the VIP room that felt foreboding to Jessica. It was {i:them}, Maria and the others who believed in witches.
Steam (ST): In Jessica's eyes, the ill-omened thing wasn't the witch or the VIP room. It was "them", Maria and the others who believed in witches.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): To Jessica, the ill-omened thing wasn't the witch or the VIP room. It was 'them', Maria and the others who believed in witches.
PC Japanese (JP): 朱志香にとって不吉なのは、魔女でも貴賓室でもない。……真里亞や彼らなどの、魔女を妄信する“彼ら”そのものなのだ。
Russian (RU): Для неё были зловещими не ведьма и почётная комната, а *они* — Мария и другие, кто верят в ведьм.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Não era a bruxa ou o quarto VIP que pareciam agourentos para Jessica. Eram {i:eles}, Maria e todos os outros que acreditavam na bruxa.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 對朱志香來說的不吉，不是魔女，不是貴賓室。……而是真里亞和他們等等，在妄信魔女的“他們”本身。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 对朱志香来说的不吉，不是魔女，不是贵宾室。……而是真里亚和他们等等，在妄信魔女的“他们”本身。

Umineko Project (UP): In the end, Jessica forced them to agree, and she made them bring her the key to the VIP room...
Steam (ST): In the end, Jessica forced them to agree, and she made them bring her the key to the VIP room...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): In the end, Jessica forced them to agree, and she made them bring her the key to the VIP room...
PC Japanese (JP): 結局、朱志香は二人を強引に説き伏せ、貴賓室の鍵を持って来させた…。
Russian (RU): В конце концов Джессика вынудила их согласиться и принести ей ключ от почётной комнаты...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): No fim, Jessica os forçou a concordar e os fez irem buscar a chave do quarto VIP para ela...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 最後，朱志香硬是迫使他們兩人拿來了貴賓室的鑰匙…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 最后，朱志香硬是迫使他们两人拿来了贵宾室的钥匙…。

Speaker: Willard H. Wright
Umineko Project (UP): "A classic test of courage, to see if {f:5:Beatrice} would really appear in the VIP room or not."
Steam (ST): "So you went on a classic test of courage, to see if {f:5:Beatrice} would really appear in the VIP room or not."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "A classic test of courage, to see if Beatrice would really appear in the VIP room or not."
PC Japanese (JP): 「ベアトリーチェが本当に貴賓室に現れるかどうか、肝試しをしたというわけか。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「ベアトリーチェが本当に貴賓室に現れるかどうか、肝試しをしたというわけか」
Russian (RU): "Классическая проверка на храбрость — проверить, появится ли {f:5:Беатриче} в почётной комнате."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Um clássico teste de coragem, para ver se {f:5:Beatrice} vai mesmo aparecer ou não no quarto VIP."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「你是以“貝阿朵莉切會不會真在貴賓室出現”試了試自己的膽量麼？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「你是以“贝阿朵莉切会不会真在贵宾室出现”试了试自己的胆量么？」

Speaker: Ushiromiya Jessica
Umineko Project (UP): "Pretty much. ......Still, I wonder why I was so stubborn about it. It must have been because of my fight with such a little girl."
Steam (ST): "Pretty much. ...Still, I wonder why I was so fixated on doing it. I must still have been brooding over that fight I had with little Maria."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「そんなとこだぜ。……しかし、私は何を意地になってたんだろうな。年端も行かない真里亞との喧嘩を、引き摺ってたに違いない。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「そんなとこだぜ。……しかし、私は何を意地になってたんだろうな。年端も行かない真里亞との喧嘩を、引き摺ってたに違いない」
Russian (RU): "Да, в общем‐то. ......И всё же, я удивляюсь своему тогдашнему упрямству. Наверное, это из‐за спора с такой маленькой девочкой."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Bem isso mesmo. ......Ainda assim, eu me pergunto por que de eu ter sido teimosa com isso. Deve ter sido por causa da minha briga com aquela guriazinha."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「就是這麼回事嘞。……不過，我到底是在賭什麼氣呢？毫無疑問，我心裡放不下和年紀幼小的真里亞吵的那場架。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「就是这么回事嘞。……不过，我到底是在赌什么气呢？毫无疑问，我心里放不下和年纪幼小的真里亚吵的那场架。」

Umineko Project (UP): ......Of course, the weather just had to be terrible on that particular night.
Steam (ST): ...Of course, the weather just had to be terrible on that particular night.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ……その晩は、実におあつらえ向きの悪天候だったぜ。
Russian (RU): ......Естественно, так вышло, что погода в эту ночь была ужасна.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......É claro, o clima acabou ficou horrível naquela noite específica.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……當晚確實是個，要什麼來什麼的糟天氣嘞。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……当晚确实是个，要什么来什么的糟天气嘞。

Umineko Project (UP): To be honest, I slightly regretted sticking my nose into something so pointless.
Steam (ST): To be honest, I slightly regretted sticking my nose into something so pointless.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): To be honest, I slightly regretted sticking my nose into something so pointless.
PC Japanese (JP): 正直なところ、下らないことに頭を突っ込んじまったなと後悔はしてた。
Russian (RU): Если честно, я даже пожалела, что сунула нос в нечто столь бессмысленное.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Honestamente, eu me arrependi levemente por ter me metido em algo tão sem sentido.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 老實說，當時我後悔自己一頭扎進無聊事裡了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 老实说，当时我后悔自己一头扎进无聊事里了。

Umineko Project (UP): But I'd already said so much, and even borrowed the key from them.
Steam (ST): But I'd already said so much...and even borrowed the key from them.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): But I'd already said so much, and even borrowed the key from them.
PC Japanese (JP): しかしもう、あれだけの啖呵を切って、鍵も借りちゃってる。
Russian (RU): Но я уже столько наговорила, даже одолжила у них ключ.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mas eu já tinha dito aquilo, e até peguei a chave com eles.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 但是我已經大嗓門喊了那麼久，連鑰匙都借來了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 但是我已经大嗓门喊了那么久，连钥匙都借来了。

Umineko Project (UP): I couldn't just go to Shannon the next day, let her ask me how it went, and answer "well, I got scared so I gave up, tehehe......" That'd just be pathetic.
Steam (ST): I couldn't just go to Shannon the next day, have her ask me how it went, and answer 'well, I gave up 'cause it was too scary, tehehe...' That'd just be pathetic.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I couldn't just go to Shannon the next day, let her ask me how it went, and answer 'well, I got scared so I gave up, tehehe......'
PC Japanese (JP): 明日になって紗音に、どうでしたかと聞かれて、怖いから結局やめたわ、てへへ……、何てわけには、絶対いかない。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 明日になって紗音に、どうでしたかと聞かれて、怖いから結局やめたわ、てへへ……、なんてわけには、絶対いかない。
Russian (RU): Не могла же я встретить на следующий день Шаннон, дать ей спросить меня, как всё прошло, и ответить 'Ну, я испугалась, поэтому не стала, эхе‐хе'... Это было бы просто смешно.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu não podia simplesmente chegar na Shannon no dia seguinte, deixar ela perguntar como foi, e ter que responder "bem, eu fiquei com medo e desisti, tehehe......" Isso seria patético.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 到了明天，被紗音問“怎麼樣”，因為怕了所以沒去什麼的，哎嘿嘿……，可絕對不能，變成這樣啊。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 到了明天，被纱音问“怎么样”，因为怕了所以没去什么的，哎嘿嘿……，可绝对不能，变成这样啊。

Umineko Project (UP): Normally, I go to sleep long before {nobr:2 a.m}.
Steam (ST): Normally, I go to sleep long before 2:00 AM.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Normally, I go to sleep long before 2:00 AM.
PC Japanese (JP): 午前２時なんて、普段ならとっくに寝てる時間だ。
Russian (RU): Обычно я иду спать задолго до 2:00.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Normalmente, eu vou dormir bem antes das duas da manhã.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 午夜 2 點，要是換做平時，我早就睡了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 午夜 2 点，要是换做平时，我早就睡了。

Umineko Project (UP): If Mom found me wandering the corridors at that time of night, she'd definitely yell at me.
Steam (ST): If Mom found me wandering the corridors at that time of night, she'd definitely yell at me.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): If Mom found me wandering the corridors at that time of night, she'd definitely yell at me.
PC Japanese (JP): そんな時間に、ぼさっと廊下を歩いてるとこなんか見つかったら、母さんにどやされちまう。
Russian (RU): Застав меня в коридоре в такое позднее время, мама наверняка накричала бы на меня.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Se minha mãe descobrisse que eu estava vagando de madrugada pelos corredores, ela certamente iria gritar comigo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 倘若被人看到，我在這種時間呆呆地走在走廊上，那我准會挨媽媽一頓臭罵。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 倘若被人看到，我在这种时间呆呆地走在走廊上，那我准会挨妈妈一顿臭骂。

Umineko Project (UP): So, I waited in my room, staring at the hands of my clock as it ticked closer to {nobr:2 a.m}.
Steam (ST): So, I waited in my room, staring at the hands of my clock as it ticked closer to 2:00.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): So, I waited in my room, staring at the hands of my clock as it ticked closer to 2:00.
PC Japanese (JP): だから、時計の針が午前２時に近付くのを、じっと見つめながら、自分の部屋で待っていたよ。
Russian (RU): Поэтому я ждала в своей комнате, уставившись на стрелки часов, которые были всё ближе к двум часам.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Por isso, eu esperei no meu quarto, encarando os ponteiros do meu relógio conforme eles se aproximavam das duas horas da manhã.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 所以，我等在自己的房間之中，一動不動地緊盯著時鐘的針靠近午夜 2 點。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 所以，我等在自己的房间之中，一动不动地紧盯着时钟的针靠近午夜 2 点。

Umineko Project (UP): Outside, the rain was incredible, and the wind strong.{n}The swaying, rustling trees were particularly creepy.
Steam (ST): Outside, the rain was incredible, and the wind strong. The swaying, rustling trees were particularly eerie.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Outside, the rain was incredible, and the wind strong. The swaying, rustling trees were particularly eerie.
PC Japanese (JP): 外は酷い雨、そして強い風だった。ばっさばさと樹木が揺れてて薄気味悪かった。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 外は酷い雨、そして強い風だった。{n}ばっさばさと樹木が揺れてて薄気味悪かった。
Russian (RU): За окном лил невообразимый дождь и дул сильный ветер.{n}Особенно жуткими казались шуршащие, покачивающиеся деревья.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Do lado de fora, a chuva estava terrível e o vento muito forte.{n}As árvores balançando e farfalhando eram especialmente assustadoras.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 外面狂風，暴雨。{n}樹木“啪沙啪沙”地搖來搖去，很是恐怖。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 外面狂风，暴雨。{n}树木“啪沙啪沙”地摇来摇去，很是恐怖。

Umineko Project (UP): I'd complained to Shannon and Gohda about making up ghost stories for my house, ......but I was starting to feel as though they had a bit of a place after all.
Steam (ST): I'd complained to Shannon and Gohda about making up ghost stories about my house, ...but I was starting to feel like those ghost stories might not be so impossible after all.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I'd complained to Shannon and Gohda about making up ghost stories for my house, ......but I was starting to feel as though those ghost stories might not be so impossible after all.
PC Japanese (JP): 自分の家に勝手に怪談を作るなと、紗音たちの前では息巻いたけど。……今は怪談を、ちょっとは認めてもいいかなという気持ちだった。
Russian (RU): Я бы пожаловалась Шаннон и Годе на то, как они придумывают для моего дома истории о призраке...... но мне стало казаться, что эти истории могут и не быть такими невероятными.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu tinha reclamado com a Shannon e o Gohda por ficarem inventando histórias de fantasmas sobre a minha casa, ......mas também comecei a sentir como se eles tivessem um pouco de razão sobre isso.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 雖然我曾在紗音他們面前怒道，別自說自話地給我家編怪談。……但我現在稍微有點覺得，承認下怪談也無妨了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 虽然我曾在纱音他们面前怒道，别自说自话地给我家编怪谈。……但我现在稍微有点觉得，承认下怪谈也无妨了。

Umineko Project (UP): ......The Ushiromiya mansion is huge.
Steam (ST): ...The Ushiromiya mansion is huge.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ……右代宮の屋敷は広い。
Russian (RU): ......Особняк Уширомия огромен.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......A mansão dos Ushiromiya é imensa.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……右代宮家的大屋很大。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……右代宫家的大屋很大。

Umineko Project (UP): Honestly, I can't think of the entire mansion as my own house.
Steam (ST): Honestly, I can't think of the entire mansion as my own house.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Honestly, I can't think of the entire mansion as my own house.
PC Japanese (JP): 正直なところ、屋敷の中、全てが自分の家だとは思ってない。
Russian (RU): Честно говоря, я даже не могу считать весь особняк своим домом.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Sinceramente, eu não consigo imaginar a mansão toda como sendo a minha própria casa.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 老實說，我並不覺得，大屋之內的空間，全都屬於自己的家。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 老实说，我并不觉得，大屋之内的空间，全都属于自己的家。

Umineko Project (UP): As Mom says, the hallways of the Ushiromiya mansion should be treated like public roads.
Steam (ST): As Mom says, the hallways of the Ushiromiya mansion should be treated like public roads.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): As Mom says, the hallways of the Ushiromiya mansion should be treated like public roads.
PC Japanese (JP): 母さんが言うように、右代宮の屋敷では、廊下は公道と同じだ。
Russian (RU): Как говорила мама, к коридорам особняка Уширомия следует относиться как к общественным дорогам.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Como minha mãe diz, os corredores da mansão dos Ushiromiya devem ser tratados como vias públicas.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 就像媽媽說的那樣，在右代宮家的大屋裡，走廊等於公共通道。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 就像妈妈说的那样，在右代宫家的大屋里，走廊等于公共通道。

Umineko Project (UP): In other words, my own room is part of my home, ......but the hallways and the rooms I don't usually enter are "outside".
Steam (ST): In other words, my own room is part of my home, ...but the hallways and the rooms I don't usually enter are "outside".
Original Witch Hunt (OG): In other words, my own room is part of my home, ......but the hallways and the rooms I don't usually enter are 'outside'.
PC Japanese (JP): つまり、自分の部屋は家だけれど、……廊下や、普段出入りしない部屋は、立派な、外なんだ。
Russian (RU): Иначе говоря, моя комната — часть моего дома...... а коридор и комнаты, в которые я обычно не захожу, — 'улица'.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ou seja, meu quarto é parte da minha casa, ......mas os corredores e quartos que eu não costumo entrar são "exteriores".
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 也就是說，儘管自己的房間是屬於自己的家，……但走廊與平時不出入的房間，完全就是，外面。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 也就是说，尽管自己的房间是属于自己的家，……但走廊与平时不出入的房间，完全就是，外面。

Umineko Project (UP): So, while part of me felt that this VIP room ghost story was ridiculous, ......the other part of me was so creeped out that it kept trying to convince itself that the first part of me was right.
Steam (ST): So, while part of me felt that this VIP room ghost story was ridiculous, ...another part of me was so creeped out that it kept frantically trying to convince itself that the first part of me was right.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): So, while part of me felt that this VIP room ghost story was ridiculous, ......the other part of me was so creeped out that it kept trying to convince itself that the first part of me was right.
PC Japanese (JP): だから、貴賓室の怪談を、馬鹿馬鹿しいと思う気持ち半分と、……そう無理やり思い込もうとするくらいの、薄気味悪さ半分だった。
Russian (RU): Поэтому, хотя часть меня считала страшилку почётной комнаты глупостью...... другой части было так жутко, что она убеждала себя в правоте первой части.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Por isso, enquanto parte de mim sentia que a história de fantasma sobre o quarto VIP era ridícula, ......a outra parte estava com tanto medo que continuava tentando se convencer que a primeira parte de mim estava certa.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 所以，我對貴賓室的怪談感到的，一半是荒謬，……一半是陰森到迫使我去將之信以為真的惡寒。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 所以，我对贵宾室的怪谈感到的，一半是荒谬，……一半是阴森到迫使我去将之信以为真的恶寒。

Umineko Project (UP): Ten to two.
Steam (ST): Only 10 minutes left 'til 2:00.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Only 10 minutes left 'til 2:00.
PC Japanese (JP): 午前２時まで、あと１０分くらいになる。
Russian (RU): До 2:00 осталось 10 минут.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Dez pras duas.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 離午夜 2 點，還差 10 分鐘左右。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 离午夜 2 点，还差 10 分钟左右。

Umineko Project (UP): If I want to greet {nobr:2 a.m.} inside the VIP room, I need to have already gone in there before then.
Steam (ST): If I wanna be inside the VIP room at 2:00, I need to get there before then.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): If I want to be inside the VIP room at 2:00, I need to go in there before then.
PC Japanese (JP): 午前２時を貴賓室で迎えようと思ったら、その前の時間にはもう、貴賓室に入っていなくはならない。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 午前２時を貴賓室で迎えようと思ったら、その前の時間にはもう、貴賓室に入っていなくてはならない。
Russian (RU): Если хочу быть в почётной комнате в два, нужно идти туда раньше.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Se eu quero passar a chegada das {nobr:2 a.m.} dentro do quarto VIP, eu precisaria ir logo antes que fosse tarde.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 若想在貴賓室迎來午夜 2 點的話，就必須在這之前的時間走進貴賓室。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 若想在贵宾室迎来午夜 2 点的话，就必须在这之前的时间走进贵宾室。

Speaker: Ushiromiya Jessica
Umineko Project (UP): "......Guess it's time. ......Sorry, but I'm not giving up that easy."
Steam (ST): "...Guess it's time. ...Sorry, but I'm not giving up that easy."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「……行くか。……悪ぃが私も意地だぜ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……行くか。……悪ぃが私も意地だぜ」
Russian (RU): "......Кажется, пора. ......Извините, но я так просто не сдамся."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Acho que tá na hora. ......Foi mal, mas eu não desisto tão fácil."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……走吧。……不好意思，咱可是人拼一口氣嘞。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……走吧。……不好意思，咱可是人拼一口气嘞。」

Umineko Project (UP): Nothing's going to happen. I know that.{n}It'll just be a stupid waste of time for a few minutes.
Steam (ST): Nothing's going to happen. I know that. It'll just be a stupid waste of time for a few minutes.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Nothing's going to happen. I know that. It'll just be a stupid waste of time for a few minutes.
PC Japanese (JP): 何も起こるわけがない。わかってる。馬鹿馬鹿しい数分間を過ごすだけだ。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 何も起こるわけがない。わかってる。{n}馬鹿馬鹿しい数分間を過ごすだけだ。
Russian (RU): Ничего не случится. Я знаю.{n}Просто глупо потрачу несколько минут.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Nada vai acontecer. Eu sei disso.{n}Serão só alguns minutos perdidos por algo estúpido.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 什麼都不會發生的。我明白的。{n}也就只是去待個傻透了的幾分鐘而已。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 什么都不会发生的。我明白的。{n}也就只是去待个傻透了的几分钟而已。

Umineko Project (UP): I touched the doorknob to the door of my room......and was startled by how unpleasantly cold it was.
Steam (ST): I touched the doorknob to the door of my room... and was startled by how unpleasantly cold it was.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I touched the doorknob to the door of my room, ......and was startled by how unpleasantly cold it was.
PC Japanese (JP): 自分の部屋のドアノブに触れ、……気持ち悪いくらいに冷え切っていて、どきりとする。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 自分の部屋のドアノブに触れ、……気持ち悪いくらいに冷え切っていて、どきりとする。
Russian (RU): Я прикоснулась к ручке двери своей комнаты... и поразилась тому, до чего же она была неприятно холодной.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu toquei a maçaneta da porta do meu quarto......e fiquei assustada em como ela estava fria.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 伸手碰到自己房間的門把手時，……冰冷到叫人心裡發毛，我頓時心頭一驚。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 伸手碰到自己房间的门把手时，……冰冷到叫人心里发毛，我顿时心头一惊。

Umineko Project (UP): As long as I stayed in this room, I could laugh off anything.
Steam (ST): As long as I stayed in this room, I could laugh off anything.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): As long as I stayed in this room, I could laugh off anything.
PC Japanese (JP): この部屋にいる限り、私は何でも馬鹿に出来る、笑ってられる。
Russian (RU): В этой комнате я ещё могла отшучиваться.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Contanto que eu ficasse no quarto, eu poderia rir o quanto quisesse.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 只要待在這房間裡，我就能去小瞧、去嘲笑任何東西。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 只要待在这房间里，我就能去小瞧、去嘲笑任何东西。

Umineko Project (UP): After all, this was {i:my} room.
Steam (ST): After all, this was MY room.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): After all, this was MY room.
PC Japanese (JP): だって私は、この部屋の主なのだから。
Russian (RU): Ведь это {i:моя} комната.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Afinal, era o {i:meu} quarto.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這是因為，我是這個房間的主人。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这是因为，我是这个房间的主人。

Umineko Project (UP): But it wouldn't be like that in the hallway. ......That's...outside my territory.
Steam (ST): But it wouldn't be like that in the hallway. ...That's...outside my territory.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): But it wouldn't be like that in the hallway. ......That's...outside my territory.
PC Japanese (JP): でも、廊下は違う。……私の、テリトリーの外だ。
Russian (RU): Но в коридоре всё иначе. ......Он... за пределами моей территории.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mas não seria assim no corredor. ......É fora...do meu território.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 但是，走廊就不一樣了。……那兒，就在我的地盤之外了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 但是，走廊就不一样了。……那儿，就在我的地盘之外了。

Umineko Project (UP): And the doorknob, the barrier between the two, was ice‐cold...
Steam (ST): And the doorknob, the barrier between the two, is ice-cold...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): And the doorknob, the barrier between the two, is ice-cold...
PC Japanese (JP): その境界を分けるドアのノブが、こんなにも冷え切ってるなんて。
Russian (RU): И дверная ручка — барьер между ними — просто ледяная...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A maçaneta, a barreira entre ambos os lados, estava fria como gelo...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 劃分開兩片疆域的門的門把手，竟然冰冷到了這種地步。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 划分开两片疆域的门的门把手，竟然冰冷到了这种地步。

Umineko Project (UP): ......Idiot... What are you so scared of, me?
Steam (ST): ...Idiot... What are you so scared of, me?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......Idiot... What are you so scared of, me?
PC Japanese (JP): ……くそったれ…。ビビってんのかよ、私。
Russian (RU): ......Идиотка... Чего ты так боишься, я?
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Idiota... Do que eu estou com tanto medo?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……王八蛋…。怕了嗎，我？
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……王八蛋…。怕了吗，我？

Umineko Project (UP): You aren't taking Shannon's, Gohda‐san's, ...or maybe Kumasawa‐san's gossip seriously, are you...?
Steam (ST): You aren't taking Shannon's, Gohda-san's, ...or maybe Kumasawa-san's gossip seriously, are you...?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=ST]
PC Japanese (JP): まさか紗音や郷田さん、あるいは熊沢さんの与太話を真に受けてるってのか…？
Russian (RU): Ты же не воспринимаешь всерьёз сплетни Шаннон, Годы... или, может, Кумасавы?..
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu não vou levar a sério a Shannon e o Gohda‐san, ...muito menos as fofocas da Kumasawa‐san, vou...?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 我難道是把紗音鄉田，或熊澤婆婆的胡言亂語當真了嗎…？
Chinese Simplified (CN): 我难道是把纱音乡田，或熊泽婆婆的胡言乱语当真了吗…？

Umineko Project (UP): I'll prove it! There's nothing strange in the VIP room...!!
Steam (ST): I'll prove it! There's nothing strange in the VIP room...!!
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=ST]
PC Japanese (JP): 私が証明してやろうぜ、貴賓室には何もいなかった、って…！
Russian (RU): Я докажу! В почётной комнате нет ничего необычного!..
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu vou provar! Vou provar que não tem nada de estranho no quarto VIP...!!
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 我來證明，證明貴賓室裡什麼都沒有…！
Chinese Simplified (CN): 我来证明，证明贵宾室里什么都没有…！

Umineko Project (UP): The corridor was only dimly lit.
Steam (ST): The corridor was only dimly lit.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 廊下は、薄明かりだけだった。
Russian (RU): В коридоре горел тусклый свет.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O corredor estava mal‐iluminado.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 走廊上，只有著微弱的亮光。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 走廊上，只有着微弱的亮光。

Umineko Project (UP): The hallways were brighter before "lights out".
Steam (ST): Before "lights out" time, the hallways were brighter.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Before we started that 'lights out' time, the hallways were brighter.
PC Japanese (JP): いわゆる、消灯時間以前なら、もっと明かりはついてる。
Russian (RU): До того, как мы ввели время выключения света, в коридорах было светлее.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Os corredores eram bem claros antes dos "apagões".
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 要是換成所謂的熄燈時間之前的話，那就會開著更多的燈。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 要是换成所谓的熄灯时间之前的话，那就会开着更多的灯。

Umineko Project (UP): But to avoid wasting energy or something like that, we kept the lights to a minimum at night.
Steam (ST): But to avoid wasting energy or something like that, we kept the lights to a minimum at night.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): But to avoid wasting energy or something like that, we'd started keeping the lights at night to a minimum.
PC Japanese (JP): でも深夜は、電気の無駄遣いとか何とかで、明かりは最小限ということになっているのだ。
Russian (RU): Но чтобы не тратить энергию, мы начали снижать свет ночью до минимума.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mas para evitar desperdício de energia ou algo do tipo, nós mantínhamos as luzes no mínimo durante a noite.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 不過深夜，出於浪費電等什麼什麼的原因，規定了只開最小限度的燈。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 不过深夜，出于浪费电等什么什么的原因，规定了只开最小限度的灯。

Umineko Project (UP): So, even though I was inside my own house, ......it was very obviously the middle of the night here.
Steam (ST): So, even though I was inside my own house, ...it was very clearly "the middle of the night" here.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): So, even though I was inside my own house, ......it was very obviously 'the middle of the night' here.
PC Japanese (JP): そのせいで、私は自分の家の中でありながらも、……こうして明白な深夜を、味わっている。
Russian (RU): Поэтому, хоть я и находилась в своём доме...... здесь была явная 'середина ночи'.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Por isso, mesmo dentro do meu próprio quarto, ......ficava bem óbvio que estávamos no meio da noite.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 因此，儘管是在自己家中，……我卻還是在如這般地品味著，顯而易見的深夜。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 因此，尽管是在自己家中，……我却还是在如这般地品味着，显而易见的深夜。

Umineko Project (UP): ......If Mom found out that I was wandering around at a time like this to do a test of courage in the VIP room, which I'm not supposed to go in, I'd get in a lot of trouble.
Steam (ST): ...If Mom found out that I was wandering around at a time like this to do a test of courage in the VIP room, which I'm not even supposed to go in, I'd get in a lot of trouble.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ……こんな時間にうろうろしてて、……入ってはいけない貴賓室に肝試しに行こうとしてるなんて母さんにバレたら、こっ酷く叱られる。
Russian (RU): ......Если мама узнает, что я в такое время устроила себе проверку на храбрость в почётной комнате, куда не должна заходить, у меня будет куча неприятностей.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Se a minha mãe descobrisse que eu estava perambulando aquela hora para fazer o teste de coragem do quarto VIP, o qual eu não deveria ir, eu ficaria cheia de problemas.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……要是被媽媽知道，我在這種時間晃來晃去，……想去不可進入的貴賓室試膽，我肯定會被她狠狠斥責一頓。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……要是被妈妈知道，我在这种时间晃来晃去，……想去不可进入的贵宾室试胆，我肯定会被她狠狠斥责一顿。

Umineko Project (UP): To make sure she didn't find out, I tried to hide my breathing and my footsteps.{n}......So, the silence felt unbelievably loud.
Steam (ST): To make sure she didn't find out, I tried to hide my breathing and my footsteps. ...So, the silence felt unbelievably loud.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): To make sure she didn't find out, I tried to hide my breathing and my footsteps.......So, the silence felt unbelievably loud.
PC Japanese (JP): 母さんに知られないために、息を殺し、足音も、殺す。……だから、信じられないくらいに、うるさい静寂。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 母さんに知られないために、息を殺し、足音も、殺す。{n}……だから、信じられないくらいに、うるさい静寂。
Russian (RU): Чтобы она не узнала, я затаила дыхание и шла как можно тише.{n}......Поэтому тишина казалась невероятно громкой.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Para ter certeza que ela não descobriria, eu tentei ocultar minha respiração e os meus passos.{n}......Assim, o silêncio ficava parecendo incrivelmente alto.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 為了不被媽媽知道，我壓低了呼吸，壓低了，腳步聲。{n}……所以四周是一片，安靜到難以置信的，吵死人的靜寂。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 为了不被妈妈知道，我压低了呼吸，压低了，脚步声。{n}……所以四周是一片，安静到难以置信的，吵死人的静寂。

Umineko Project (UP): Even though it was so quiet, ......the eerie sound of the wind was loud in my ears.
Steam (ST): Even though it was so quiet, ...that eerie sound of the wind was noisy.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Even though it was so quiet, ......that eerie sound of the wind was noisy.
PC Japanese (JP): こんなにも静かなのに、……不気味な風の音がうるさい。
Russian (RU): Хотя было очень тихо...... шумел жуткий ветер.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mesmo estando tão quieto, ......o sinistro som do vento era alto aos meus ouvidos.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 明明是這麼安靜，……陰森的風聲卻又好吵。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 明明是这么安静，……阴森的风声却又好吵。

Umineko Project (UP): The sound of twigs rustling. The sound of some pillar in this old mansion creaking.
Steam (ST): The sound of twigs rustling. The sound of some pillar in this old mansion creaking.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The sound of twigs rustling. The sound of some pillar in this old mansion creaking.
PC Japanese (JP): 小枝の絡まる音。おんぼろ屋敷のどこかの柱が泣く音。
Russian (RU): Шуршание веток. Скрип столбов в этом старом особняке.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O som dos galhos farfalhando. O som de algum pilar dessa casa velha estalando.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 樹枝纏在一起的聲音。破房子某處柱子的哭泣的聲音。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 树枝缠在一起的声音。破房子某处柱子的哭泣的声音。

Umineko Project (UP): What's that sound like a beak tapping against glass?
Steam (ST): What's that sound like a beak tapping against glass?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): What's that sound like a beak tapping against glass?
PC Japanese (JP): 唐突に聞こえる、ガラスを嘴がコツリと打つような音は何なの？
Russian (RU): Что это был за звук, похожий на постукивание клювом о стекло?
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Qual era o som daquilo parecido com um bico batendo no vidro?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 忽然傳入耳中的，恰似鳥嘴“突突”啄玻璃般的，又是什麼聲音？
Chinese Simplified (CN): 忽然传入耳中的，恰似鸟嘴“突突”啄玻璃般的，又是什么声音？

Umineko Project (UP): Though it was so quiet, ......all of the little, suspicious sounds felt obnoxiously loud.
Steam (ST): Though it was so quiet, ...all of the little, suspicious sounds made it seem noisy.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Though it was so quiet, ......all of the little, suspicious sounds made it seem noisy.
PC Japanese (JP): こんなにも静寂なのに、……ものすごくたくさんの怪しい音が、うるさい。
Russian (RU): Несмотря на полную тишину...... из‐за всех тех мелких, подозрительных звуков становилось шумно.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Embora estivesse tão quieto, ......todos esses pequenos sons suspeitos pareciam desagradavelmente altos.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 明明是如此寂靜，……卻又有超多超多怪異的聲音吵個不停。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 明明是如此寂静，……却又有超多超多怪异的声音吵个不停。

Umineko Project (UP): Damn, I'm an idiot. Why couldn't I have brought a flashlight, at least?
Steam (ST): Damn, I'm an idiot. Why couldn't I have brought a flashlight, at least?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Damn, I'm an idiot. Why couldn't I have brought a flashlight, at least?
PC Japanese (JP): あぁ、私は本当に馬鹿。懐中電灯くらい用意すれば良かった。
Russian (RU): Чёрт, вот дура. Надо было хоть фонарик с собой взять.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Merda, eu sou muito idiota. Por que eu vim sem trazer uma lanterna?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 啊——，我真是個笨蛋。要是至少有準備手電筒就好了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 啊——，我真是个笨蛋。要是至少有准备手电筒就好了。

Umineko Project (UP): A flashlight to use inside my own home?{n}......Hah, that's even more idiotic...
Steam (ST): A flashlight to use inside my own home? ...Hah, that's even more idiotic...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): A flashlight to use inside my own home?......Hah, that's even more idiotic...
PC Japanese (JP): 自分の家の中で懐中電灯？……はっ、ますますに馬鹿馬鹿しい…。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 自分の家の中で懐中電灯？{n}……はっ、ますますに馬鹿馬鹿しい…。
Russian (RU): Светить фонариком в своём же доме?{n}......Ха, это ещё глупее...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Uma lanterna para usar dentro da minha própria casa?{n}......Hah, isso seria ainda mais idiota...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 在自己家裡，用手電？{n}……哈，越來越傻了…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 在自己家里，用手电？{n}……哈，越来越傻了…。

Umineko Project (UP): I mumbled this to myself, hoping it would drown out the sound of the wind just a little...
Steam (ST): I mumbled this to myself, hoping it would drown out the sound of the wind just a little...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I mumbled this to myself, hoping it would drown out the sound of the wind just a little...
PC Japanese (JP): そんな悪態を口にすることで、少しでも風の音が聞こえないようにする…。
Russian (RU): Бормоча себе под нос, я надеялась хотя бы немного заглушить шум ветра...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu resmunguei isso para mim mesma, esperando que isso pudesse abafar o som do vento, ao menos minimamente...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 我如這般嘴上罵罵咧咧，盡可能地令自己聽不到風聲…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 我如这般嘴上骂骂咧咧，尽可能地令自己听不到风声…。

Umineko Project (UP): .........Then, ......I saw it. The door to the VIP room.
Steam (ST): ......Then, ...I saw it. The door to the VIP room.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ………見えた。貴賓室の、……扉だ。
Russian (RU): .........И тогда...... я увидела её. Дверь в почётную комнату.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): .........Então, ......eu a vi. A porta do quarto VIP.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ………看到了。是貴賓室的，……門。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ………看到了。是贵宾室的，……门。

Umineko Project (UP): ......The VIP room was supposedly reserved for important guests.
Steam (ST): ...This was the VIP room, the room for important guests.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......This was the VIP room, the room for important guests.
PC Japanese (JP): ……貴賓室は、特別なお客様のための部屋、ということになっていた。
Russian (RU): ......Почётная комната предназначена для важных гостей.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......O quarto VIP supostamente ficava reservado para convidados importantes.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……貴賓室是一間專門招待特別的客人的房間。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……贵宾室是一间专门招待特别的客人的房间。

Umineko Project (UP): However, as far as I knew, it had never been used.
Steam (ST): However, as far as I knew, it had never been used before.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): However, as far as I knew, it had never been used before.
PC Japanese (JP): しかし、この部屋が使用されたことは、私の知る限り、ただの一度もない。
Russian (RU): Однако, насколько я знаю, она всегда пустовала.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mas, até onde eu sei, ele nunca foi usado.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 然而，在我所知的範圍內，這間房間一次都未被人用過。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 然而，在我所知的范围内，这间房间一次都未被人用过。

Umineko Project (UP): None of the guests who came to this mansion......had ever been given the right to use this room.
Steam (ST): None of the guests who came to this mansion...were important enough to be given use of this room.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): None of the guests who came to this mansion......were important enough to be given use of this room.
PC Japanese (JP): この屋敷を訪れるどんな客人も、……この部屋を使う資格を与えられはしなかった。
Russian (RU): Никто из гостей, приезжавших в особняк...... не был достаточно важным для этой комнаты.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Nenhum dos convidados que vinha à mansão......jamais teve o direito de usar aquele quarto.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 無論怎樣的客人到訪這幢大屋，……都不會得到使用這房間的資格。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 无论怎样的客人到访这幢大屋，……都不会得到使用这房间的资格。

Umineko Project (UP): Though I'd been clutching the key all this time, it didn't feel warm at all.{n}The icy metal tormented me ruthlessly.
Steam (ST): Though I'd been clutching that key the whole time, it didn't feel warm at all. It still ruthlessly and icily tormented me.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Though I'd been clutching the key all this time, it didn't feel warm at all. It still ruthlessly and icily tormented me.
PC Japanese (JP): 握り締めていたはずの鍵は、ちっとも温もりを持たない。相変わらず冷酷に、……その冷たさで私を苛んでいる。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 握り締めていたはずの鍵は、ちっとも温もりを持たない。{n}相変わらず冷酷に、……その冷たさで私を苛んでいる。
Russian (RU): Ключ, который я всё это время сжимала, совсем не казался тёплым.{n}Он по‐прежнему мучил меня безжалостным холодом.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Embora eu tivesse ficado apertando a chave o tempo todo, eu não senti calor algum. O gélido metal me atormentou impiedosamente.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 緊握在手中的鑰匙，一點都沒變暖。{n}依舊冷酷地以，……它身上的那份冰冷苛責著我。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 紧握在手中的钥匙，一点都没变暖。{n}依旧冷酷地以，……它身上的那份冰冷苛责着我。

Umineko Project (UP): Maybe that was a warning. ......“If you go back to your comfortable room and hide in your bed, this night will pass like any other...”
Steam (ST): Or maybe that was a warning. "...If you go back to your comfortable room and hide in your bed, this night will pass like any other..."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Or maybe that was a warning. ......'If you go back to your comfortable room and hide in your bed, this night will pass like any other...'
PC Japanese (JP): あるいは、これは警告なのかもしれない。……ぬくぬくとした自室へ帰って布団を被れば、いつもと同じ、何事もない夜を過ごせるのに、という…。
Russian (RU): Или, может, предупреждал. ......'Если вернёшься в свою уютную комнату и спрячешься под одеялом, эта ночь пройдёт так же, как любая другая'...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Talvez fosse um aviso. ......“Se voltar para o seu confortável quarto e se esconder na sua cama, a noite passará como qualquer outra...”
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 或許，這就是警告也說不定。……在警告說，明明只要肯回自己熱乎乎的房間蓋上被子，你就能跟往常一樣，度過啥事沒有的一晚了…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 或许，这就是警告也说不定。……在警告说，明明只要肯回自己热乎乎的房间盖上被子，你就能跟往常一样，度过啥事没有的一晚了…。

Speaker: Ushiromiya Jessica
Umineko Project (UP): "......Like hell I'm doing that. I can't give up after coming this far."
Steam (ST): "...Don't mess with me. I can't give up after coming this far."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......Don't mess with me. I can't give up after coming this far."
PC Japanese (JP): 「……馬鹿にすんじゃねぇぜ。ここまで来て、今さら引き下がれるかってんだ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……馬鹿にすんじゃねぇぜ。ここまで来て、今さら引き下がれるかってんだ」
Russian (RU): "......Ну уж нет. Зайдя так далеко, я не могу отступить."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Até parece que vou fazer isso. Eu não posso desistir depois de vir até aqui."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……可別小瞧我嘞。都走到這了，事到如今，哪能再回去啊？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……可别小瞧我嘞。都走到这了，事到如今，哪能再回去啊？」

Umineko Project (UP): The key had been freezing in my hand, urging me to turn back.{n}......But the keyhole made no further attempt to stop me.
Steam (ST): Even though the key was freezing in my hand, telling me to go back... ...It slipped into the keyhole quite easily.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Even though the key was freezing in my hand, telling me to go back.........It slipped into the keyhole quite easily.
PC Japanese (JP): こんなにも鍵は冷え切って、私を拒んでくれたのに。……鍵穴はもはや、何も抵抗しなかった。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): こんなにも鍵は冷え切って、私を拒んでくれたのに。{n}……鍵穴はもはや、何も抵抗しなかった。
Russian (RU): Хотя ключ морозил мне руку, говоря вернуться...{n}......Он легко скользнул в замочную скважину.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A chave estava congelando na minha mão, me incitando a dar meia‐volta.{n}......Mas a fechadura não fez nenhuma tentativa de me impedir.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 明明鑰匙是如此冰冷地拒絕著我。{n}……可鑰匙孔卻沒做任何抵抗。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 明明钥匙是如此冰冷地拒绝着我。{n}……可钥匙孔却没做任何抵抗。

Umineko Project (UP): All that's left.........is to turn the knob, open the door, ......and I'll be inside the VIP room.
Steam (ST): All that's left... ...is to turn the knob, open it, ...and I'll be inside the VIP room.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): All that's left.........is to turn the knob... open it......and I'll be inside the VIP room.
PC Japanese (JP): あとは、……ノブを捻って、開けば、……そこが貴賓室。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): あとは、……ノブを捻って、開けば、……そこが貴賓室。
Russian (RU): Осталось лишь......... повернуть ручку, открыть дверь...... и я буду в почётной комнате.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): E tudo que resta.........é girar a maçaneta, abrir a porta, ......e eu estarei dentro do quarto VIP.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 接下來，……只需轉下門把手，開門，……眼前就是貴賓室了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 接下来，……只需转下门把手，开门，……眼前就是贵宾室了。

Umineko Project (UP): ......It's not like I've {i:never} been in the VIP room.
Steam (ST): ...It's not like I've never been in there before.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......It's not like I've never been in the VIP room.
PC Japanese (JP): ……貴賓室に入ったことは、ないわけじゃない。
Russian (RU): ......Не скажу, что я там никогда не была.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Não é como se eu {i:nunca} tivesse entrado no quarto VIP.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……我並不是從未進過貴賓室。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……我并不是从未进过贵宾室。

Umineko Project (UP): Long ago, when I would often play hide‐and‐seek or go exploring, this room that I rarely entered had seemed unusual and exciting.
Steam (ST): Long ago, I explored and played hide-and-seek all the time, and this room that I rarely entered seemed unusual and exciting.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Long ago, when I would often play hide-and-seek or go exploring, this room that I rarely entered had seemed unusual and exciting.
PC Japanese (JP): ずいぶん昔、家の中で隠れん坊をしたり、探検したりして遊んでた頃は、普段立ち入らないこの部屋が、とても珍しかった。
Russian (RU): Давным‐давно, когда я часто играла в прятки и выходила на разведку, эта комната, в которую я редко ступала, казалась необычной и захватывающей.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Muito tempo atrás, eu costumava brincar de esconde‐esconde ou sair fazendo explorações, esse quarto, que eu raramente entrava, parecia muito diferente e empolgante.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 很久以前，在家中玩捉迷藏、探險的時候，平時不能進的房間，對我來說非常稀奇。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 很久以前，在家中玩捉迷藏、探险的时候，平时不能进的房间，对我来说非常稀奇。

Umineko Project (UP): However, I got in trouble for going in, and was told that this room was important, so one mustn't enter without reason. After that, they made a rule of locking up unused rooms, and I couldn't go in anymore.
Steam (ST): However, I got in trouble for going in, and was told that this room was important, so one mustn't enter without reason. After that, they made a rule of locking up unused rooms, and I couldn't go in anymore.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): However, I got in trouble for going in, and was told that this room was important, so one mustn't enter without reason. After that, they made a rule of locking up unused rooms, and I couldn't go in anymore.
PC Japanese (JP): しかし、この部屋は大切な部屋だからみだりに入ってはならないと怒られ、その後、使わない部屋には鍵をするルールになったので、私は入ることも出来なくなった。
Russian (RU): Но мне запрещали ходить туда, говоря, что в эту важную комнату нельзя заходить без причины. Потом создали правило запирания пустующих комнат, и я больше не могла войти.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mas eu tive problemas fazendo isso, e foi dito que esse quarto era importante, por isso ninguém deveria entrar sem um motivo. No fim, fizeram até uma regra sobre trancar quartos vagos, e eu não pude mais entrar.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 不過後來我被罵了，這房間是重要的房間，不准隨便進，在這之後，就有了“沒人用的房間須上鎖”的規矩，我就再也沒法進去了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 不过后来我被骂了，这房间是重要的房间，不准随便进，在这之后，就有了“没人用的房间须上锁”的规矩，我就再也没法进去了。

Umineko Project (UP): ......So, ...it's probably been several years since I last went into the VIP room. In fact, ......it might be more than a decade.
Steam (ST): ...So, ...it's probably been several years since I've gone into the VIP room. In fact, ...it might be more than ten years since the last time.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......So, ...it's probably been several years since I've gone into the VIP room. In fact, ......it might be more than ten years since the last time.
PC Japanese (JP): ……だから、貴賓室に入るのは、………多分、数年ぶり。いや、……十年以上さえも経るかもしれない。
Russian (RU): ......Так что... думаю, прошло несколько лет с тех пор, как я входила в почётную комнату. А вообще...... с последнего раза могло пройти более десяти лет.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Por isso, ...acho que já faz muitos anos desde a última vez que entrei no quarto VIP. Na verdade, ......pode ser que faça mais de uma década.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……所以，距上次進貴賓室，………多半，已隔了好幾年。不，……或許都已有十多年了也說不定。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……所以，距上次进贵宾室，………多半，已隔了好几年。不，……或许都已有十多年了也说不定。

Umineko Project (UP): The inside of the room is probably different from how it was when I knew of it.
Steam (ST): The inside of the room has probably changed from how I remember it.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The inside of the room is probably different from how it was when I knew of it.
PC Japanese (JP): 部屋の中は、私の知る頃とはきっと異なっているだろう。
Russian (RU): Внутри комната, возможно, отличается от той, какой я её знала.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O interior do quarto provavelmente deve estar diferente daquilo que eu me lembro.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 房中，一定與我所知道的時候，不一樣了吧？
Chinese Simplified (CN): 房中，一定与我所知道的时候，不一样了吧？

Umineko Project (UP): ......Come to think of it, even then, I felt that there was something unsettling about this room...
Steam (ST): ...Come to think of it, even then, I felt that there was something unsettling about it...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ……思えばあの頃も、この部屋のことを、どこか不気味だと思っていたものだ…。
Russian (RU): ......Кстати, даже тогда эта комната казалась мне тревожной...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Pensando nisso, mesmo agora, eu sinto que tem algo inquietante sobre esse quarto...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……想來那時，就覺得這房間哪裡有點叫人心裡發毛…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……想来那时，就觉得这房间哪里有点叫人心里发毛…。

Umineko Project (UP): Slowly, I pushed the door open.
Steam (ST): Slowly, I pushed the door open.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Slowly, I pushed the door open.
PC Japanese (JP): 扉をゆっくりと、押し開く。
Russian (RU): Я медленно толкнула дверь.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Lentamente, eu empurrei a porta.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 慢慢，推開門。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 慢慢，推开门。

Umineko Project (UP): It was light, ......and even after I let go of it, it kept opening by itself, as though beckoning me in...
Steam (ST): The door was light, ...and even after I let go of it, it kept opening by itself, as though beckoning me in...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It was light, ......and even after I let go of it, it kept opening by itself, as though beckoning me in...
PC Japanese (JP): 扉は軽く、……手を離した後も、まるで私を誘うように、ひとりでに開いていった…。
Russian (RU): Она была лёгкой...... и даже после того, как я отпустила её, открывалась сама по себе, будто манила меня войти...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ela era leve, ......e mesmo depois que eu a larguei, ela continuou se abrindo como se estivesse acenando para que eu entrasse...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 門輕輕的，……在我將手從門上挪開後，它也照樣如在邀我進去般地自動開了…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 门轻轻的，……在我将手从门上挪开后，它也照样如在邀我进去般地自动开了…。

Umineko Project (UP): Beyond it......was a darkness as thick and heavy as ink...
Steam (ST): Beyond it...was a darkness as thick and heavy as ink...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Beyond it......was a darkness as thick and heavy as ink...
PC Japanese (JP): その先は……、墨のようにべったり、どろりとした、……暗闇。
Russian (RU): За ней...... была темнота, густая и тяжёлая, как чернила...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Além dela......estava uma escuridão tão densa quanto tinta...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 在我眼前……，如墨水般緊貼著，粘粘糊糊的，……黑暗。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 在我眼前……，如墨水般紧贴着，粘粘糊糊的，……黑暗。

Umineko Project (UP): Even the dim light that seeped in from the corridor seemed bright in contrast.
Steam (ST): Even the dim light that peeked in from the corridor seemed bright in contrast.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Even the dim light that peeked in from the corridor seemed bright in contrast.
PC Japanese (JP): あんなにも薄暗いと思っていた廊下から漏れ入る明かりさえ、くっきりとコントラストを感じさせる。
Russian (RU): Даже тусклый свет, просачивающийся из коридора, в сравнении выглядел ярким.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A tênue luz que adentrava do corredor parecia muito brilhante em contraste.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 就連之前認為昏暗得要命的從走廊漏入的燈光，都能讓人感到鮮明的對比。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 就连之前认为昏暗得要命的从走廊漏入的灯光，都能让人感到鲜明的对比。

Umineko Project (UP): ......Swallowing hard, ......I stuck my head in, feeling about for the light switch next to the doorway.
Steam (ST): ...*gulp*. ...I stuck my head in, feeling about for the light switch next to the doorway.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......*gulp*. ......I stuck my head in, feeling about for the light switch next to the doorway.
PC Japanese (JP): ……ごくりと。……硬い唾を飲み込んでから、私は首を突っ込み、入口脇の照明のスイッチを探る。
Russian (RU): ......*глоть*. ......Я просунула туда голову, ища рядом с дверью переключатель.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Engolindo profundamente, ......eu enfiei minha cabeça para dentro, tateando atrás do interruptor próximo à porta.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……咕嘟。……硬生生咽下一口唾沫，我把頭伸了進去，找起了門邊的電燈開關。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……咕嘟。……硬生生咽下一口唾沫，我把头伸了进去，找起了门边的电灯开关。

Umineko Project (UP): This was a horribly unnatural and awkward way to do it.{n}......All I really had to do was step inside and search for the switch from there.
Steam (ST): This was a horribly awkward and uncomfortable way to do it. All I really had to do was step inside and search for the switch from there.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): This was a horribly awkward and uncomfortable way to do it. All I really had to do was step inside and search for the switch from there.
PC Japanese (JP): それはひどく不自然で不器用な格好。……中に踏み入って、自然に壁を探ればいいのに。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): それはひどく不自然で不器用な格好。{n}……中に踏み入って、自然に壁を探ればいいのに。
Russian (RU): Делать это было ужасно неловко и неудобно.{n}Мне нужно лишь шагнуть внутрь и найти переключатель оттуда.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Essa foi uma forma nada natural e horrível de descrever isso.{n}......Tudo o que eu realmente tinha que fazer era dar um passo para dentro e procurar pelo interruptor.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這是個非常不自然且不順手的姿勢。{n}……明明只需走到裡面，順其自然地在牆上找下就行了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这是个非常不自然且不顺手的姿势。{n}……明明只需走到里面，顺其自然地在墙上找下就行了。

Umineko Project (UP): Unwilling to take even a single step into the room, ......I timidly stuck just my arm into the darkness and felt along the wall...
Steam (ST): Unwilling to take even a single step into the room, ...I timidly stuck just my arm into the darkness and felt along the wall...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Unwilling to take even a single step into the room, ......I timidly stuck just my arm into the darkness and felt along the wall...
PC Japanese (JP): 部屋にたった一歩、踏み入ることさえ嫌い、……こうして、恐る恐る、腕だけ闇に突っ込んで壁を探っているのだ…。
Russian (RU): Не желая делать и шага в комнату...... я робко протиснула руку в темноту и вела ею вдоль стены...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Por não querer dar esse único passo para dentro do quarto, ......eu timidamente enfiei meu braço na escuridão e fui tateando a parede...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 可我就連跨入房中一步都不願意，……像這樣戰戰兢兢，光是把手伸進黑暗裡地，在牆上找來找去…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 可我就连跨入房中一步都不愿意，……像这样战战兢兢，光是把手伸进黑暗里地，在墙上找来找去…。

Umineko Project (UP): Click.
Steam (ST): *click*
Original Witch Hunt (OG): *click*
PC Japanese (JP): カチン。
Russian (RU): *щёлк*.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): [=UP]
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 咔嘰。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 咔叽。

Umineko Project (UP): The switch, which was hardly ever used, felt stiff and lifeless.
Steam (ST): The switch, which was hardly ever used, felt stiff and lifeless.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 普段、あまり使用されることのない、そのスイッチは、とても無機質で固かった。
Russian (RU): Почти не используемый переключатель казался жёстким и безжизненным.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O interruptor, que raramente era usado, parecia duro e sem vida.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 平常基本沒人用的這個電燈開關很緊，泛著無機質的冰冷氣息。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 平常基本没人用的这个电灯开关很紧，泛着无机质的冰冷气息。

Umineko Project (UP): However, once the light turned on, the darkness vanished in an instant.
Steam (ST): However, once the light turned on, the darkness vanished in an instant.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): However, once the light turned on, the darkness vanished in an instant.
PC Japanese (JP): しかし、明かりが灯れば、呆気ないくらいに、暗闇は払われる。
Russian (RU): Но когда свет включился, тьма моментально рассеялась.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mas, uma vez que as luzes ligassem, a escuridão desapareceria na mesma hora.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 不过，灯一亮，黑暗就堪称没劲地一下子就被赶跑了。

Umineko Project (UP): And there, ......exactly as it had been, ......as though not a thing had changed in all these years, ...was the VIP room.
Steam (ST): And there, ...exactly as it had been, ...as though not a thing had changed in all these years, was the VIP room.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): And there, ......exactly as it had been... as though not a thing had changed in all these years... was the VIP room.
PC Japanese (JP): そこには、……見当も付かないくらい古い記憶の中の光景と、……寸分、変わらない、貴賓室があった。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): そこには、……見当も付かないくらい古い記憶の中の光景と、……寸分、変わらない、貴賓室があった。
Russian (RU): И там...... точно такая же, как раньше...... словно за все эти годы ничего не изменилось, была почётная комната.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): E lá estava, ......exatamente como era, ......como se nada tivesse acontecido nos último anos, ...estava o quarto VIP.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 在裡面的是，……與古老到都忘了具體怎麼回事的陳舊記憶中的情景，……毫釐，不差的，貴賓室。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 在里面的是，……与古老到都忘了具体怎么回事的陈旧记忆中的情景，……毫厘，不差的，贵宾室。

Umineko Project (UP): ......The curtain and bed cover might have been slightly different, and maybe the chairs and the like had changed too.
Steam (ST): ...The curtain and bed cover might have been slightly different, and maybe the chairs and the like had changed too.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ……カーテンやベッドカバーは、多少は違うかもしれないし、ひょっとしたら椅子なども違うかもしれない。
Russian (RU): ......Занавески и покрывало, возможно, слегка отличались, и, может, изменились стулья.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......As cortinas e a cama estavam levemente diferentes, e talvez as cadeiras também tenham mudado.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……窗簾床罩也許多少有點不一樣，搞不好椅子什麼的也有點不一樣吧？

Umineko Project (UP): Still, .........if I had to put it in words, I'd call it the feel.{n}......The stiff, lifeless feel of this room hadn't changed.
Steam (ST): Still, ...if I had to put it in words, I'd call it the feel. ...The stiff, lifeless feel of this room hadn't changed.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Still, ......if I had to put it in words, I'd call it the feel.......The stiff, lifeless feel of this room hadn't changed.
PC Japanese (JP): でも、………一言でいえば、空気。……あの、硬い、無機質な空気は、何も変わらなかった。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): でも、………一言でいえば、空気。{n}……あの、硬い、無機質な空気は、何も変わらなかった。
Russian (RU): И всё же, выражаясь словами, я бы назвала это атмосферой.{n}......Жёсткая, безжизненная атмосфера этой комнаты ничуть не изменилась.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mesmo assim, .........se eu tivesse que colocar em palavras, seria a sua atmosfera.{n}......A dura sensação sem vida do quarto não tinha mudado.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 不過，………要以一句話來講的話，就是空氣。{n}……那硬邦邦的，了無生氣的空氣，沒有任何改變。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 不过，………要以一句话来讲的话，就是空气。{n}……那硬邦邦的，了无生气的空气，没有任何改变。

Umineko Project (UP): If I hang around here, someone might find me. ......I'd rather not have Mom find me here.
Steam (ST): If I hang around here, someone might find me. ...I'd rather not have Mom find me here.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): If I hang around here, someone might find me. ......I'd rather not have Mom find me here.

Steam (ST): I readied myself, ...and though I couldn't even bring myself to enter this room when the lights were out, ...I finally entered.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I readied myself, ......and though I couldn't even bring myself to enter this room with the lights out, ......I finally entered.

Russian (RU): Я приготовилась......и несмотря на то, что даже не могла заставить себя войти в эту комнату, когда был выключен свет...... наконец вошла.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu me preparei, ......e, embora eu não tenha sido capaz de entrar no quarto com as luzes apagadas, .........eu finalmente entrei.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 下定決心，……我踏入了，連僅僅只是找個電燈開關都不敢走進去找的，………那間房間。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 下定决心，……我踏入了，连仅仅只是找个电灯开关都不敢走进去找的，………那间房间。

Steam (ST): As soon as I closed the door, I felt an oppressive, suffocating sensation.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): As soon as I closed the door, I felt an oppressive, suffocating sensation.
PC Japanese (JP): 扉を閉める時、窒息するような息苦しさを覚えた。

Chinese Traditional (CHT): 在關上門時，我感受到了恰似窒息的氣悶。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 在关上门时，我感受到了恰似窒息的气闷。

Steam (ST): All right, ...I've shut myself up in the VIP room. Bring it, {f:5:Beatrice}.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Alright, ......I've shut myself in the VIP room. Come out, Beatrice.

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Certo, ......eu me fechei dentro do quarto VIP. Apareça, {f:5:Beatrice}.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……现在，几分了…？」

Steam (ST): I'm not in the habit of wearing a watch around the house. ...Damn. Now I'm not sure what time it is.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I'm not in the habit of wearing a watch around the house. ......Damn. Now I'm not sure what time it is.

Steam (ST): Still, I know there's only a few minutes left at most.

Umineko Project (UP): I tried to suppress my desire to use "going to get a clock" as an excuse to run away from this place...
Steam (ST): I tried to suppress my desire to use "going to get a clock" as an excuse to run away from this place...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I tried to suppress my desire to use 'going to get a clock' as an excuse to run away from this place...
PC Japanese (JP): 時計を取りに行くのを口実に、ここを逃げ出すという甘えを、ぐっと心の奥に押し込める…。

Chinese Simplified (CN): 我使劲儿将想以拿表为借口逃出这房间的那份懦弱，压到了心底…。

Speaker: Ushiromiya Jessica
Steam (ST): "......What's this?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ".........What's this?"

Steam (ST): ...If this room had been used often, I'd have thought it was just one of the owner's personal belongings.

Original Witch Hunt (OG): Just who managed to find this doll, and where?

Chinese Simplified (CN): 是哪的谁把这种娃娃找出来的呢？

Steam (ST): There's no doubt that someone placed the doll here to symbolize {f:5:Beatrice}.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): There's no doubt that someone placed the doll here to symbolize Beatrice.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 毋庸置疑，肯定是某人以此来暗示贝阿朵莉切地把它放在了这。

Steam (ST): Does that mean...this doll is supposed to be the owner of this room, or something...?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Does that mean...this doll is supposed to be the owner of this room, or something...?

Russian (RU): Выходит, владелец комнаты — эта кукла?..
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Isso significa...que essa boneca supostamente representa a dona do quarto ou algo parecido...?

Chinese Simplified (CN): 照这么说，这个娃娃，就正可谓是这间房间的主人么…？

Steam (ST): And, looking like an offering to that owner, ...there sat a small plate with several cookies and wrapped chocolates.

Russian (RU): И словно в подношение этому владельцу...... там лежала маленькая тарелка с печеньем и конфетами.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): E, como se fosse uma oferenda à dona, ......havia um pequeno prato servido com vários cookies e bombons.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 其次，如在供奉這位主人般，……那裡擺著個小盤子，盤中放著一些小甜餅與被紙包住的巧克力。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 其次，如在供奉这位主人般，……那里摆着个小盘子，盘中放着一些小甜饼与被纸包住的巧克力。

Umineko Project (UP): It was all set out neatly, and there was no dust piled up on the doll.
Steam (ST): It was all set out neatly, and there was no dust piled up on the doll.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It was all set out neatly, and there was no dust piled up on the doll.
PC Japanese (JP): 小綺麗に置かれ、人形には埃も積もっていない。
Russian (RU): Всё было аккуратно разложено, а на кукле совсем не скопилась пыль.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Estava tudo muito organizado e não tinha poeira acumulada na boneca.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 擺得挺整潔漂亮的，娃娃上都沒積灰塵。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 摆得挺整洁漂亮的，娃娃上都没积灰尘。

Umineko Project (UP): ......In other words, both the doll and the offering were being taken care of on a regular basis by the servants, and kept in good condition along with the rest of the room.
Steam (ST): ...In other words, both the doll and the offering were taken care of on a regular basis by the servants, kept in good condition along with the rest of the room.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......In other words, both the doll and the offering were taken care of on a regular basis by the servants, and kept in good condition along with the rest of the room.
PC Japanese (JP): ……つまり、この人形もお供えも、日々、使用人たちによって手入れされ、部屋同様に維持されているということだ。
Russian (RU): ......Получается, слуги регулярно заботятся о кукле и подношении, содержа их в чистоте и порядке вместе с комнатой.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Em outras palavras, tanto a boneca quanto a oferenda faziam parte da rotina de serviço dos serviçais, sendo mantidos em boas condições, junto com o restante do quarto.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……換言之，這也就代表著，這個娃娃還有供品，每天都有被傭人們收拾，與房間一樣地被維持在原狀。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……换言之，这也就代表着，这个娃娃还有供品，每天都有被佣人们收拾，与房间一样地被维持在原状。

Umineko Project (UP): Taken care of? ......No, it was more than that.
Steam (ST): Taken care of? ...No, it's more than that.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Taken care of? ......No, it's more than that.
PC Japanese (JP): 手入れ？　……いや、これは手入れなんかじゃない。
Russian (RU): Заботятся?.. ......Нет, не только.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Rotina de serviços? ......Não, era mais do que isso.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 收拾？……不，這才不算收拾什麼的呢。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 收拾？……不，这才不算收拾什么的呢。

Umineko Project (UP): It looked like an offering...no, like some sort of worship, a prayer saying "please don't curse us"...
Steam (ST): It looked like an offering...no, like some sort of worship, a prayer saying "please don't curse us"...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It looked like an offering...no, like some sort of worship, a prayer saying 'please don't curse us'...
PC Japanese (JP): どうか、私たちを祟らないで下さいという、お供え、……いや、まるで崇拝にさえ見える。
Russian (RU): Напоминало подношение... или некое поклонение, молитву 'Пожалуйста, не проклинай нас'...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Parecia mais como uma oferenda...não, tipo uma adoração, uma reza dizendo "por favor, não nos amaldiçoe"...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這是代表著“請千萬別對我們作祟”的供奉，……不，看起來甚至像是崇拜。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这是代表着“请千万别对我们作祟”的供奉，……不，看起来甚至像是崇拜。

Umineko Project (UP): ......So, while the doll was eerie enough by itself, ......psychologically, it was even more unnerving to think about how it must have been kept safe and worshiped in a place like this.
Steam (ST): ...So, even though the doll was more than eerie enough by itself, ...viscerally, it was even more unnerving to imagine it being been kept safe and worshiped in a place like this.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ……だから、人形そのものも充分に不気味だったが、……こんなところに安置され、敬われているということそのものが、生理的に気持ち悪かった。
Russian (RU): ......Кукла сама по себе жуткая...... но мысль о том, как её бережно хранят здесь и поклоняются ей, психологически нервировала ещё больше.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Por isso, embora a boneca já fosse sinistra o bastante, ......psicologicamente falando, era ainda mais enervante pensar sobre como ela era mantida em segurança e adorada em um lugar como aquele.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……所以，雖然娃娃本身就夠陰森了，……但單純對它被安放到這種地方受人崇敬一事，我是從生理上感到了噁心。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……所以，虽然娃娃本身就够阴森了，……但单纯对它被安放到这种地方受人崇敬一事，我是从生理上感到了恶心。

Speaker: Ushiromiya Jessica
Umineko Project (UP): "Stupid. ......Am I supposed to clap my hands together and say "please don't curse me"?"
Steam (ST): "Stupid. ...Am I supposed to clap my hands together and say "please don't curse me"?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Stupid. ......Am I supposed to clap my hands together and say 'please don't curse me'?"
PC Japanese (JP): 「馬鹿馬鹿しいぜ。……祟らないで下さいって、拍手でも打つのかよ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「馬鹿馬鹿しいぜ。……祟らないで下さいって、拍手でも打つのかよ」
Russian (RU): "Ну и чушь. ......Мне сложить ладони и сказать 'Прошу, не проклинай меня'?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Que estúpido. ......Por acaso eu deveria juntar as mãos e dizer "por favor, não me amaldiçoe"?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「傻透了嘞。……難道還要拍手說，請不要作祟麼？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「傻透了嘞。……难道还要拍手说，请不要作祟么？」

Umineko Project (UP): Jessica forced herself to look away from the bizarre doll.
Steam (ST): Jessica forced herself to look away from the bizarre doll.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 薄気味悪いその人形から、朱志香は無理やり目を逸らす。
Russian (RU): Джессика с трудом оторвала взгляд от странной куклы.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Jessica se forçou a desviar seu olhar daquela boneca bizarra.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 朱志香強迫自己將視線偏離陰森森的娃娃。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 朱志香强迫自己将视线偏离阴森森的娃娃。

Umineko Project (UP): ......She couldn't bring herself to sit on a bed that wasn't hers.{n}Then again, she didn't really feel like sitting down on a chair either.
Steam (ST): ...She couldn't bring herself to sit on a bed that wasn't hers. Then again, she didn't really feel like sitting down on a chair either.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......She couldn't bring herself to sit on a bed that wasn't hers. Then again, she didn't really feel like sitting down on a chair either.
PC Japanese (JP): ……自分のでないベッドに腰掛ける気にはなれない。かといってもはや、椅子に腰掛ける気にもなれない。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): ……自分のでないベッドに腰掛ける気にはなれない。{n}かといってもはや、椅子に腰掛ける気にもなれない。
Russian (RU): ......Она не могла заставить себя сесть не на свою кровать.{n}С другой стороны, на стул ей садиться тоже не хотелось.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Ela não conseguia se sentar em uma cama que não a pertencia.{n}Mais uma vez, ela também não se sentia bem em sentar‐se em uma cadeira.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……我可不想坐到不屬於自己的床上。{n}不過話雖如此，我現已連坐在椅子上的想法都沒有了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……我可不想坐到不属于自己的床上。{n}不过话虽如此，我现已连坐在椅子上的想法都没有了。

Umineko Project (UP): She had lost any desire to sit on anything in this room.
Steam (ST): She had lost any desire to sit on anything in this room.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): She had lost any desire to sit on anything in this room.
PC Japanese (JP): この部屋の何かに、体を預けたいという気持ちには、もう、まったくなれなかった。
Russian (RU): Она потеряла всякое желание сесть на что‐либо в этой комнате.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ela perdeu toda e qualquer vontade de se sentar em qualquer parte do quarto.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 心中已完全涌不起，將身體靠在這房中的什麼上的念頭了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 心中已完全涌不起，将身体靠在这房中的什么上的念头了。

Umineko Project (UP): Wandering about aimlessly, ......I peeked out the window through the gaps in the curtains to stare at the dark, rainy night.
Steam (ST): I wandered about aimlessly, ...then peeked out the window through the gaps in the curtains to stare at the dark, rainy night.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I wandered about aimlessly, ......then peeked out the window through the gaps in the curtains to stare at the dark, rainy night.
PC Japanese (JP): 私は所在なくうろつき、……カーテンの隙間から、風雨が濡らし続ける闇夜の窓ガラスをぼんやり眺めていた。
Russian (RU): Я бесцельно блуждала...... потом выглянула в окно через щель в занавесках и посмотрела на тёмную, дождливую ночь.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Vagando sem rumo, ......eu espiei pela janela, através de uma fresta na cortina e encarei a escura noite chuvosa.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 我隨處亂走，……從窗簾的縫隙間，呆呆地眺望不斷被風雨淋濕的黑夜中的窗玻璃。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 我随处乱走，……从窗帘的缝隙间，呆呆地眺望不断被风雨淋湿的黑夜中的窗玻璃。

Umineko Project (UP): ......What the hell am I doing?
Steam (ST): ...What the hell am I doing?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......What the hell am I doing?
PC Japanese (JP): ……私は何をやってんだ。
Russian (RU): ......Какого чёрта я делаю?
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Que merda eu tô fazendo?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……我在做什麼呢？
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……我在做什么呢？

Umineko Project (UP): Hanging about in the VIP room this late just because that fight with Maria is still eating at me... ......This is beyond stupid... I'm disappointed in myself.
Steam (ST): Hanging about in the VIP room this late just because that fight with Maria is still eating at me... This is totally pointless...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Hanging about in the VIP room this late just because that fight with Maria is still eating at me... This is totally pointless...
PC Japanese (JP): 真里亞との喧嘩を、まだ引き摺ってて、こんな時間に貴賓室でぼんやりしてるなんて、……馬鹿馬鹿しいを通り越して、自分に呆れる…。
Russian (RU): Торчу в почётной комнате так поздно лишь потому, что мне до сих пор не даёт покоя стычка с Марией... Как глупо...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Passeando pelo quarto VIP a essa hora da noite só porque aquela briga com a Maria ainda está me incomodando... ......Isso é estúpido demais... Estou desapontada comigo mesmo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 放不下與真里亞的吵架，在這種時間於貴賓室裡呆呆地犯傻，……都超過了傻透了的境界，我都對自己無語了…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 放不下与真里亚的吵架，在这种时间于贵宾室里呆呆地犯傻，……都超过了傻透了的境界，我都对自己无语了…。

Umineko Project (UP): {f:5:Beatrice}, huh...
Steam (ST): {f:5:Beatrice}.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Beatrice.
PC Japanese (JP): ベアトリーチェ、か。
Russian (RU): {f:5:Беатриче}.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): {f:5:Beatrice}, é...?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 貝阿朵莉切，麼？
Chinese Simplified (CN): 贝阿朵莉切，么？

Umineko Project (UP): Just when did that strange witch start living in this mansion...?
Steam (ST): Just when did that strange witch start living in this mansion...?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Just when did that strange witch start living in this mansion...?
PC Japanese (JP): 一体、いつの頃から、このおかしな魔女はこの屋敷に住み込むようになったんだ…？
Russian (RU): С каких же пор эта странная ведьма живёт в особняке?..
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Quando foi que aquela bruxa estranha começou a viver nesta mansão...?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 究竟，是從什麼時候起，這位詭異的魔女住進了這幢大屋呢…？
Chinese Simplified (CN): 究竟，是从什么时候起，这位诡异的魔女住进了这幢大屋呢…？

Umineko Project (UP): ......Grandfather's always yelling about {f:5:Beatrice}.
Steam (ST): ...Grandfather's always yelling about {f:5:Beatrice}.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......Grandfather's always yelling about Beatrice.
PC Japanese (JP): ………祖父さまが、いつもベアトリーチェ、ベアトリーチェと叫んでて。
Russian (RU): ......Дед постоянно кричит о ней.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......O vovô sempre fica gritando sobre a {f:5:Beatrice}.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ………爺爺老是在那大叫“貝阿朵莉切，貝阿朵莉切”。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ………爷爷老是在那大叫“贝阿朵莉切，贝阿朵莉切”。

Umineko Project (UP): Since it's apparently the name of his dead mistress, people started talking about how her ghost must haunt this mansion.
Steam (ST): Since it's apparently the name of his dead mistress, people started talking about how her ghost must haunt this mansion.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Since it's apparently the name of his dead mistress, people started talking about how her ghost must haunt this mansion.
PC Japanese (JP): 死んだ愛人の名前らしいから、きっとその亡霊が屋敷に出るんだろう、なんて話になって。
Russian (RU): Когда стало очевидно, что так звали его покойную любовницу, люди начали говорить, что особняк преследует её призрак.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Como parece ser o nome da sua falecida amante, as pessoas começaram a falar que o fantasma dela assombrava a mansão.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 因為那好像是爺爺死去的情婦的名字，所以有了“肯定是她的亡靈在這大屋裡出沒”的傳聞。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 因为那好像是爷爷死去的情妇的名字，所以有了“肯定是她的亡灵在这大屋里出没”的传闻。

Umineko Project (UP): There's that kids' horror story about the witch in the forest, which might be a ghost story made by the adults to stop the kids from going in there.
Steam (ST): There's that kids' horror story about the witch in the forest, which might be a ghost story made by the adults to stop the kids from going in there.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): There's that kids' horror story about the witch in the forest, which might be a ghost story made by the adults to stop the kids from going in there.
PC Japanese (JP): 森には魔女がいるから近寄ってはいけない、という子供のホラ話、もしくは子供が森に近付かないように大人が作った怪談があって。
Russian (RU): Есть детская страшилка о лесной ведьме, придуманная взрослыми, чтобы дети не ходили по лесу.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Tem uma história de terror para crianças que fala sobre a bruxa da floresta, a qual também pode ser uma história de fantasma feita pelos adultos para impedir as crianças de irem até ela.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 有著“森林裡有魔女，所以不可靠近”的，小孩子間的嚇人故事，或，大人為不讓小孩子靠近森林而編出來的怪談。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 有着“森林里有魔女，所以不可靠近”的，小孩子间的吓人故事，或，大人为不让小孩子靠近森林而编出来的怪谈。

Umineko Project (UP): The portrait Grandfather had hung in April was really striking.
Steam (ST): The portrait Grandfather had hung in April was really striking.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The portrait Grandfather had hung in April was really striking.
PC Japanese (JP): 祖父さまが４月に掲げたあの肖像画はインパクト絶大だった。
Russian (RU): Далее портрет, в апреле повешенный дедом.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O retrato que o vovô pendurou em abril foi uma grande surpresa.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 爺爺於 4 月掛出的那幅肖像畫，實在是極具衝擊力。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 爷爷于 4 月挂出的那幅肖像画，实在是极具冲击力。

Umineko Project (UP): And there was also that weird epitaph. ......The creepy words on that, which sounded like some sort of ritual with human sacrifices, made the name of {f:5:Beatrice} seem all the more unnerving.
Steam (ST): And there was also that weird epitaph. ...The creepy words on that, which sounded like some sort of ceremony with human sacrifices, made the name of {f:5:Beatrice} seem all the more unnerving.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): And there was also that weird epitaph. ......The creepy words on that, which sounded like some sort of ceremony with human sacrifices, made the name of Beatrice seem all the more unnerving.
PC Japanese (JP): しかもあの、薄気味悪い碑文。……生贄の儀式を思わせる、その気持ち悪い内容が、ますますにベアトリーチェの名を不気味に装飾した。
Russian (RU): Ещё и та странная эпитафия. ......Из‐за её жуткого содержания, напоминающего ритуал жертвоприношений, имя {f:5:Беатриче} стало нервировать ещё больше.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): E também tem aquele epitáfio estranho. ......As palavras sinistras descritas nele, que parecem mais uma espécie de ritual com sacrifícios humanos, fez com que o nome da {f:5:Beatrice} se tornasse enervante.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 再加上那個，叫人心裡發毛的碑文。……碑文上那令人聯想到活祭儀式的噁心的內容，越發給貝阿朵莉切這個名字裝飾上了數分陰森。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 再加上那个，叫人心里发毛的碑文。……碑文上那令人联想到活祭仪式的恶心的内容，越发给贝阿朵莉切这个名字装饰上了数分阴森。

Umineko Project (UP): At some point, those stories mixed together, and they now say that the witch {f:5:Beatrice} exists.
Steam (ST): At some point, those stories mixed together, and now people say that the witch, {f:5:Beatrice}, exists.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): At some point, those stories mixed together, and they now say that the witch Beatrice exists.
PC Japanese (JP): それらがいつの間にかミックスされて、魔女ベアトリーチェがいる、なんてことになってた。
Russian (RU): В какой‐то момент эти истории смешались, и появилась ведьма {f:5:Беатриче}.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Em determinado momento, essas histórias se matizaram e agora dizem que a bruxa {f:5:Beatrice} existe.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 它們在不知不覺間混合到了一起，變成了“魔女貝阿朵莉切真的存在”。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 它们在不知不觉间混合到了一起，变成了“魔女贝阿朵莉切真的存在”。

Umineko Project (UP): ......I don't believe in {f:5:Beatrice}...because I know she's just a fictional person made by the fusion of a few horror stories.
Steam (ST): ...I don't believe in {f:5:Beatrice}... because I know she's just a fictional person made by the fusion of a few horror stories.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......I don't believe in Beatrice... because I know she's just a fictional person made by the fusion of a few horror stories.
PC Japanese (JP): ……私がベアトリーチェという存在を信じられないのは、そういったホラ話が融合していって生まれた、架空の存在だとわかっているからだ。
Russian (RU): ......Я не верю в {f:5:Беатриче}... потому что знаю: она всего лишь вымышленный персонаж, созданный в результате слияния нескольких страшилок.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Eu não acredito na {f:5:Beatrice}...porque sei que ela é apenas uma pessoa fictícia criada a partir da fusão de algumas histórias de terror.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……我之所以不信貝阿朵莉切的存在，是因為我知道，她是由這些嚇人要素融合而誕生出來的，虛構的存在。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……我之所以不信贝阿朵莉切的存在，是因为我知道，她是由这些吓人要素融合而诞生出来的，虚构的存在。

Umineko Project (UP): The "Beatrice" who was Grandfather's mistress probably did exist.
Steam (ST): The Beatrice who was Grandfather's mistress probably did exist.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The Beatrice who was Grandfather's mistress probably did exist.
PC Japanese (JP): ベアトリーチェっていう、祖父さまの愛人は実在しただろう。
Russian (RU): Та {f:5:Беатриче}, которая была любовницей деда, может, и существовала.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A "Beatrice", amante do vovô, provavelmente existiu.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 名叫貝阿朵莉切的爺爺的情婦，是實際存在的吧？
Chinese Simplified (CN): 名叫贝阿朵莉切的爷爷的情妇，是实际存在的吧？

Umineko Project (UP): But she wasn't a witch.
Steam (ST): But she wasn't a witch.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): But she wasn't a witch.
PC Japanese (JP): しかし、それは魔女じゃない。
Russian (RU): Но она не была ведьмой.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mas ela não é uma bruxa.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 但是，她並不是魔女。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 但是，她并不是魔女。

Umineko Project (UP): The story of the witch of the forest was made up by the adults to prevent their kids from getting lost in the woods. But that was just a made‐up story, not reality.
Steam (ST): The story of the witch of the forest was made up by the adults to prevent their kids from getting lost in the woods. But that was just a made-up story, not reality.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The story of the witch of the forest was made up by the adults to prevent their kids from getting lost in the woods. But that was just a made-up story, not reality.
PC Japanese (JP): 森の魔女の話は、子供が森に近付いて迷子にならないようにと、大人が作った怪談だ。しかし、それは作り話であって、実在などしない。
Russian (RU): История о лесной ведьме придумана взрослыми, чтобы их дети не заблудились в лесу. Но это выдумка, а не реальность.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A história da bruxa da floresta foi criada por adultos para prevenir que seus filhos se perdessem no bosque. Mas essa é uma história inventada, não é realidade.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 森林魔女的故事，是為了不讓小孩接近森林，在森林中迷路，而由大人創造出來的怪談。不過，這是編出來的故事，根本不是真的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 森林魔女的故事，是为了不让小孩接近森林，在森林中迷路，而由大人创造出来的怪谈。不过，这是编出来的故事，根本不是真的。

Umineko Project (UP): In fact, I've heard that kids were once threatened about wolves living in the forest. Apparently, the kids realized that wolves couldn't exist on the island, so it was changed to the witch.
Steam (ST): In fact, I've heard that the adults here once scared the kids with stories about wolves living in the forest. Apparently, the kids realized that wolves couldn't possibly be there, so it was changed to the witch.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): In fact, I've heard that kids were once threatened about wolves living in the forest. Apparently, the kids realized that wolves couldn't exist on the island, so it was changed to the witch.
PC Japanese (JP): いや、そもそも昔は、森に出るのは狼だって脅されてたらしい。狼なんて、いるわけないって子供たちが気付いたので、魔女に話を切り替えたらしい。
Russian (RU): По правде говоря, я слышала, что раньше детей пугали волками, живущими в лесу. Видимо, дети поняли, что на острове не может быть волков, и их заменили на ведьму.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Na verdade, eu já ouvi que uma vez as crianças foram advertidas sobre lobos que viviam na floresta. Pelo que parece, as crianças perceberam que não existiam lobos na ilha, e então mudaram para uma bruxa.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 不，說到底，更早以前，好像是用“森林裡有狼”來嚇唬人的。好像是因為小孩們意識到了，“狼什麼的，根本不可能有”，所以才換成了魔女的故事。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 不，说到底，更早以前，好像是用“森林里有狼”来吓唬人的。好像是因为小孩们意识到了，“狼什么的，根本不可能有”，所以才换成了魔女的故事。

Umineko Project (UP): When the portrait was hung, ......that once‐vague character suddenly had a face, and people acted as though she'd been around since long ago.
Steam (ST): When the portrait was hung, that once-vague character suddenly had a face, and people acted as though she'd been around since long ago.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): When the portrait was hung, that once-vague character suddenly had a face, and people acted as though she'd been around since long ago.
PC Japanese (JP): そんな程度のあやふやな存在が、……あの肖像画が掛けられてから、一気に具現化し、さも大昔からいましたって感じに振舞うようになった。
Russian (RU): Когда портрет повесили, этот неопределённый персонаж вдруг приобрёл лицо, и люди повели себя так, будто она была здесь с давних пор.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Quando o retrato foi dependurado, ......a personagem ainda vaga, recebeu uma face repentinamente, e as pessoas começaram a agir como se ela já estivesse ali há muito tempo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 就這種程度的霧里觀花的存在，……自從掛出那幅肖像畫，就一下子具體化，表現出了一副“從很久以前起就一直存在著”的樣子。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 就这种程度的雾里观花的存在，……自从挂出那幅肖像画，就一下子具体化，表现出了一副“从很久以前起就一直存在着”的样子。

Umineko Project (UP): ......That's right, it's all a ghost story someone made, a fiction.
Steam (ST): ...That's right, it's all a ghost story someone made, a fiction.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ……そう、全ては作られた怪談、虚構の存在。
Russian (RU): ......Верно, всё это выдуманная другими история о призраке, вымысел.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Isso mesmo, é tudo uma história de fantasmas inventada por alguém, pura ficção.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……對，全部都是編出來的怪談，虛構的存在。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……对，全部都是编出来的怪谈，虚构的存在。

Umineko Project (UP): And Maria calls {f:5:Beatrice} her best friend, and the servants worship her like a household shrine.
Steam (ST): And Maria calls {f:5:Beatrice} her best friend, and the servants worship her like a household shrine.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): And Maria calls Beatrice her best friend, and the servants worship her like a household shrine.
PC Japanese (JP): それを真里亞は、一番の友達と呼び、使用人たちは、神棚に拝むみたいな感じで敬ってる。
Russian (RU): Мария называет {f:5:Беатриче} своей лучшей подругой, а слуги преклоняются перед ней, как перед святыней.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): E a Maria chama a {f:5:Beatrice} de melhor amiga, e os serviçais adoram ela como um santuário caseiro suspenso.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 真里亞將之稱為最好的朋友，傭人們如拜神龕般地崇敬她。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 真里亚将之称为最好的朋友，佣人们如拜神龛般地崇敬她。

Umineko Project (UP): I just don't get it, and it creeps me out......
